Written notice shall be given to the last registered owner by letter addresses to the address given on such registration and placed in the United States mail, with first-class postage affixed, such notice to set forth the charges accumulated and the charge per day. All garages thus maintained by or for a permittee under this chapter are hereby declared to be authorized garages, pursuant to section 5-56 of this chapter. 
(Ord. No. 659, § 3, 11-6-79; Ord. No. 695, 8-3-82; Ord. No. 706, 8-16-83; Ord. No. 735, § 1, 2-18-86; Ord. No. 835, § 1, 4-4-89; Ord. No. 2005-12, § 6, 4-5-06; Ord. No. 2013-16, § 7, 7-9-13; Ord. No. 2013-21, § 2, 8-13-13; Ord. No. 2013-29, § 5, 10-8-13)  
Sec. 5-61.3. - Parking of wrecker at scene of accident. 
Whenever an emergency auto wrecker arrives at the place where a motor vehicle has been disabled by an accident, the emergency auto wrecker shall park his vehicle as close to the street curb as possible and otherwise dispose of it in such a manner as not to interfere with the traffic. He shall not park his vehicle within a distance of one hundred fifty (150) feet from a wrecked or disabled vehicle unless otherwise directed by the police. 
(Ord. No. 659, § 3, 11-6-79) 
Cross reference— General parking regulations, § 22-73 et seq.  
Sec. 5-62. - Removal of vehicles; driver to sign acceptance sheet; right to remove not to be sold. 
The driver of the emergency auto wrecker who tows a disabled vehicle from the scene of an accident shall sign an acceptance sheet furnished by the police officer investigating the accident. The selling of such right to tow any disabled vehicle is prohibited. The person signing for the disabled vehicle must be able to account for the vehicle at all times. A violation of this section shall subject a permit holder to administrative penalties as set out in this article. 
(Ord. No. 659, § 3, 11-6-79)  
Sec. 5-63. - Supplemental permit for substitute emergency auto wrecker. 
Whenever an owner wishes to discontinue the use of an emergency auto wrecker during the period covered by his permit and replace it with another, he shall file an affidavit stating that he has discontinued using the emergency auto wrecker covered by his permit and desires to use another emergency auto wrecker in its place. He shall also attach a certificate from his insurer that such insurer has been notified thereof and agrees thereto. The chief of police shall then issue the owner a supplemental permit covering the new emergency auto wrecker and cause the description of the old emergency auto wrecker to be canceled from the original permit. In the affidavit, certificate from the insurer and supplemental permit, old and new emergency auto wrecker shall be described by make, model, vehicle identification number, and state license number. 
(Ord. No. 659, § 3, 11-6-79)  
ARTICLE IV. - NON-CONSENT TOWING AND REPOSSESSIONS 
 
Sec. 5-64. - Companies report all non-consent tows and repossessions to the city. 
It shall be the requirement of all companies operating within the City of South Houston, conducting non-consent tows and repossessions of vehicles within the City of South Houston, Texas, to report all non-consent tows and repossessions to the City of South Houston, Texas. All repossessions shall be reported before and after the vehicle in question is repossessed. The City of South Houston, Texas, shall maintain a record of all non-consent tows and repossessions reported to the City of South Houston, Texas. All businesses that perform non-consent tows and repossessions shall be required to be registered with and permitted by the City of South Houston, Texas. The City of South Houston, Texas, shall maintain the records of the non-consent tows and repossessions in the interest of the safety of the citizens of the City of South Houston, Texas. 
(Ord. No. 2013-16, § 1, 7-9-13; Ord. No. 2013-29, § 1, 10-8-13)  
Sec. 5-65. - Fees and fines. 
Each business that performs non-consent tows will be required to pay the City of South Houston, Texas, the sum of fifty dollars ($50.00) per non-consent tow. 
Each business that performs repossessions will be required to pay the City of South Houston, Texas, the sum of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for each vehicle repossessed in the city limits of South Houston. 
Failure to report a non-consent tow will result in a Class C Misdemeanor with a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00). 
Failure to report a repossession before a motor vehicle is repossessed will result in a Class C Misdemeanor with a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00). 
Failure to report a repossession after a motor vehicle is repossessed will result in a Class C Misdemeanor with a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00). 
Failure to register with the City of South Houston to perform non-consent tows will result in a Class C Misdemeanor with a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00). 
Failure to obtain a permit with the City of South Houston to perform non-consent tows will result in a Class C Misdemeanor with a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00). 
The non-consent tow fee and the repossession fee must be paid on or before the first of each calendar month. Failure to pay said fees on or before the first of each calendar month will result in the revocation of the company's towing permit and all towing privileges within the territorial limits of the City of South Houston, Harris County, Texas. 
Failure to pay the non-consent tow fee will result in a Class C Misdemeanor with a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00). 
Failure to pay the repossession fee will result in a Class C Misdemeanor with a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00). 
(Ord. No. 2013-16, § 2, 7-9-13; Ord. No. 2013-29, § 2, 10-8-13; Ord. No. 2014-32, § 2, 12-23-14)  
Sec. 5-66. - Authorized and registered tow trucks. 
All tow trucks conducting business within the City of South Houston, Texas, shall be registered in the City of South Houston, Texas, and shall have available in the vehicle proof of a current permit. All tow trucks must be certified to be a wrecker, verified by the display of an official factory seal of the wrecker/tow-truck manufacturer. Pickup trucks or other trucks not manufactured to be a tow truck, or wreckers that are converted from a vehicle not intended to be a wrecker, by a wrecker or tow-truck manufacturer are strictly prohibited to operate in the City of South Houston, Texas. At a minimum, the authorized tow trucks shall be required to have at least a 12,000 GVWR (gross vehicle weight), a certified registration in the City of South Houston, Texas, an 8,000 pound hydraulic wrench (no electrical rigs), proper safety inspections issued by the City of South Houston, Texas, or other cities in the case of consent tows/repossessions done by tow trucks from outside South Houston, and the State of Texas, an authorized City of South Houston, Texas, permit for tow trucks operating from within the City of South Houston, and have at least one (1) fire extinguisher appropriately sealed or contained within the tow truck at all times. Trucks will be required to have dual wheels. 
In order to maintain the permit, all companies utilizing authorized tow trucks within the City of South Houston, Texas, shall be required to list the City of South Houston, Texas, as an additional insured with an insurance policy limit of no less than five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000) for tows only, and an insurance policy limit of no less than one million dollars ($1,000,000) for repossessions. 
(Ord. No. 2013-16, § 3, 7-9-13; Ord. No. 2013-24, § 2, 8-27-13; Ord. No. 2013-29, § 3, 10-8-13)  
Sec. 5-67. - Background check of drivers. 
All drivers who intend to perform non-consent tows and repossessions under this article, with the exception of out-of-City tow trucks performing consent tows/repossessions, must register with the City of South Houston, Texas, and shall be required to pass a satisfactory background check. A driver who is denied a license or permit due to an unsatisfactory background check or for other relevant reasons may appeal the decision to the City of South Houston, Texas, Municipal Court by requesting a hearing in writing. The decision of the Municipal Court shall be final as to the driver's eligibility to be issued a license or permit. 
(Ord. No. 2013-16, § 4, 7-9-13; Ord. No. 2013-29, § 4, 10-8-13)  
Sec. 5-68. - City-approved impound storage facility. 
All non-consent tows shall be stored in the City of South Houston, Texas, in a city-approved impound storage facility. The impounded vehicles must remain at the approved facility until the owner successfully redeems the vehicle in accordance with state law or until the vehicle is sold under this article and under state law. 
Storage facilities approved to do business in the City of South Houston, Texas, as well as repossession companies, are responsible for filing monthly reports with the City of South Houston, Texas, showing how many vehicles were picked up as non-consent tows and how many were picked up as repossessions. Each storage facility and/or repossession company is additionally responsible for making the required payments to the City of South Houston, Texas, for each non-consent tow or repossession. 
All sales of abandoned towed vehicles will be performed at an approved storage facility where vehicles are stored after they are towed. At each sale, the City of South Houston, Texas, shall receive twenty-five (25) percent of the gross sales proceeds of each abandoned vehicle. The authorized storage facility shall retain seventy-five (75) percent of the sale. The authorized storage facility will also solely bear the costs associated with storage, maintenance, auction, title work, proper written notifications and all other necessary functions related to the towing, storage and sale of each vehicle in compliance with state law. 
The authorized storage facility conducting the auctions of the abandoned vehicles shall conduct the auction every two (2) months. The City of South Houston, Texas' twenty-five (25) percent portion of all gross proceeds of each sale shall be tendered by the authorized storage facility to the City Secretary of the City of South Houston, Texas, within two (2) working days after each sale. 
(Ord. No. 2013-16, § 5, 7-9-13)  
Sec. 5-69. - Required criteria of authorized storage facility. 
An authorized storage facility within the City of South Houston, Texas, shall be required to have the following criteria: 
a.  All authorized storage facilities shall comply with the requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA); 
b.  All authorized storage facilities shall be on a tract of land within the City of South Houston, containing a hard surface with approved drainage; 
c.  All authorized storage facilities shall require at least one (1) functioning 750 watt light with a minimum of two (2) functioning 750 watt lights per acre thereafter; 
d.  All authorized storage facilities shall maintain an office facility in the front of the storage facility, sufficient to allow customers adequate cover to stay dry during inclement weather; 
e.  All authorized storage facilities shall maintain an impervious fence of stone, masonry or wrought iron at least six (6) feet tall enclosing the entire storage facility; and 
f.  Shall not be permitted to be within 2,000 feet from any other storage facility. 
(Ord. No. 2013-16, § 6, 7-9-13; Ord. No. 2013-21, § 1, 8-13-13; Ord. No. 2014-12, § 2, 5-27-14; Ord. No. 2014-14, § 2, 8-12-14)  
Chapter 6 - BUILDINGS AND GENERAL BUILDING REGULATIONS[1]

ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 
 
Sec. 6-1. - Fire limits or districts. 
The fire limits or districts of the city shall be as established, from time to time, by ordinance of the city council and nothing in this Code or the ordinance adopting this Code shall affect any such ordinance and all such ordinances are hereby recognized as continuing in full force and effect to the same extent as if set out at length in this Code. 
State Law reference— Frame buildings, V.T.C.A., Local Government Code § 342.002.  
Sec. 6-2. - Reserved. 
Editor's note— Ordinance No. 2004-13, adopted May 4, 2004, repealed § 6-2 in its entirety. Formerly, such section pertained to buildings prohibited on certain land used by interurban railway and derived from Ord. No. 563, §§ 3, 4, 7-18-67.  
Sec. 6-3. - Buildings with exposed corrugated metal or galvanized iron prohibited in residential districts. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to construct, move in, alter, remodel, rebuild or add on to any resident or garage building within any residential district of the city, as established by the zoning ordinance, which building will have any exposed corrugated metal or galvanized iron when the building is completed. 
(Ord. No. 392, § 2, 10-16-56)  
Sec. 6-4. - Fences—Prohibited on city rights-of-way, easements, streets, etc. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to construct or erect a fence which, in any way, obstructs, closes, or is placed upon any rights-of-way, easements, alleys or public streets which are either dedicated, owned, owned-in-fee or leased by the city. 
(Ord. No. 465, §§ 1, 3, 4, 9-6-60; Ord. No. 2001-15, § 1, 8-21-01) 
Cross reference— Fences prohibited in parkways, § 19-16.  
Sec. 6-5. - Same—Permit to construct. 
(a)  No fence or pipe obstruction shall be erected, moved, repaired, added to, or structurally altered without a permit issued by the building official. 
(b)  All applications for a building permit for a fence shall be accompanied by a survey, in duplicate, of the property on which the fence is, or is to be, located; plans for the fence, drawn to scale, showing the actual dimensions and shape of the lot to be built upon; the location of the improvements thereon; and the location, height and type of each wall, fence, and all other types of screening. 
(c)  Prior to the issuance of a permit for the construction, reconstruction, modification, enlargement, extension, or alteration of a fence, the applicant shall stake and mark on the ground the location of the fence. If such marking, the survey, and the plans and specifications submitted show that such fence shall not be in violation of this code, a permit to construct and erect the fence will be issued by the building inspector upon payment of a fee in the amount of thirty dollars ($30.00) minimum, plus six cents ($0.06) per linear foot over twenty-five (25) feet. 
(d)  Upon completion of the construction, the fence shall be inspected by the building inspector to ensure compliance with the building permit and the following provisions of this section: 
(1)  Fences may be made of wood, chain link, wrought iron, or masonry construction. 
(2)  No barbed wire shall be allowed in Districts R1A, R1B, R2, R3 or R4. 
(3)  In a residential area of the City, no fence that is more than three (3) feet in height from grade if constructed of wood, brick, shrubbery or masonry; five (5) feet in height from grade if constructed of chain link; or six (6) feet in height from grade if constructed of wrought iron, shall be erected (i) along the property line of any lot, (ii) along the side lines of any lot within the required building setback area from the front property line, or (iii) between the front building line of the lot and a public street (or private street providing the primary access to the property). 
(4)  In any commercial area of the City of South Houston, no fence that is more than three (3) feet in height from grade if constructed of wood, brick, shrubbery, or masonry; or eight (8) feet in height from grade if constructed of chain link or wrought iron, shall be installed. Commercial property owners in a C1, C2, R5C, or M district may use barbed wire on the top of a security fence, but in no event shall the total height of structure and the barbed wire exceed ten (10) feet from grade. 
(5)  No fence or other structure that obstructs a motorist's view of the intersecting street shall be built on a corner lot within twenty-five (25) feet of the intersection corner. 
(6)  No fence that exceeds six feet, six inches, (6'6") in height, including the horizontal board along the bottom, if used, shall be constructed along the side-lines of any lot in a residential area between the front building setback line and the rear property line of the lot, or along the rear property line of said lot. 
(7)  Swimming pools, spas, and hot tubs shall be completely enclosed within a fence no greater than six feet, six inches, (6'6") in height from grade, and no less than four (4) feet in height from grade. All gates must be equipped with a self-closing spring and safety latch. 
(8)  No fence or pipe obstruction shall be constructed within five (5) feet of the property line on the street side on the following streets: Spencer, Allen-Genoa, South Shaver, College, Winkler, South Richey, or Houston Boulevard. 
(9)  No fence over six (6) feet with one foot of barbed wire can exceed seven (7) feet from grade in a commercial area within one block of College Avenue, Houston Boulevard, Winkler Drive, Spencer Highway and South Shaver. 
(Ord. No. 465, § 2, 9-6-60; Ord. No. 784, § 1, 3-1-88; Ord. No. 97-009, 4-8-97; Ord. No. 2001-15, § 2, 8-21-01; Ord. No. 2005-50, § 1, 12-20-05; Ord. No. 2011-35, § 1, 11-8-11)  
Sec. 6-6. - Temporary building permits. 
Nothing in this Code or the ordinance adopting this Code shall affect Ordinance No. 419, adopted March 4, 1958, relating to temporary building permits, and such ordinance is hereby recognized as continuing in full force and effect to the same extent as if out at length in this Code.  
Sec. 6-7. - Non-conforming fences. 
There may exist fences which were lawful before this chapter was adopted, enacted, amended, or otherwise made applicable to such fences, but which do not conform to this chapter. It is the intent of this chapter to permit such non-conforming uses to continue under regulations herein contained until the same are removed, but not to encourage their survival. No non-conforming fence shall be enlarged, changed, altered, or repaired except in conformity with the regulations contained in this Chapter. No non-conforming fence which requires repairs exceeding fifty (50) percent of its value shall be permitted for repairs unless it is re-constructed in compliance with the provisions of this chapter. 
(Ord. No. 2001-15, § 3, 8-21-01) 
Editor's note— Ordinance No. 2001-15, § 3, adopted August 21, 2001, added a new section 6-6. However, since such section exists, and at the editor's discretion, these provisions have been redesignated as a new section 6-7.  
Sec. 6-8. - Fees for engineering on building projects. 
(a)  The City of South Houston city engineer will review the scope of professional services required for obtaining a permit and then estimate the type of professional services, time, and costs by the City of South Houston for a particular City of South Houston permit. Exhibit "A," attached to this document [A copy of Ordinance No. 2002-09 can be found filed in the office of the city secretary], will detail the City of South Houston designated engineer's estimated time, costs, and the type of professional services required, in a budget format, for either a special permit fee or a permit impact fee. The budget, either unit price or lump sum, provided by the engineer will be considered as a "not to exceed" amount. If the scope of the engineer's services change due to unknown conditions, the applicant must agree to bear the cost of such change prior to the engineer's proceeding with these professional services. 
(b)  For small and minor project permits that require engineering, surveying, and/or engineering construction inspection, professional services of fewer than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00), the cost of such necessary and required professional services shall be added to the normal City of South Houston building permit's cost as a special permit fee and paid by the applicant as part of his/her normal construction permit costs. 
(c)  For large and major project permits that require engineering, surveying, and/or engineering construction inspection, professional services greater than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00), the cost of such necessary and required professional services shall first be agreed to by the applicant and then added to the normal City of South Houston building permit's cost as a permit impact fee and paid by the applicant as part of his/her normal construction permit costs. 
(d)  The engineer will be required to furnish insurance and/or be bonded for every project. 
(Ord. No. 2002-09, §§ 1—4, 4-25-02) 
Editor's note— Ordinance No. 2002-09, §§ 4, adopted April 25, 2002, did not specifically amend the Code. Therefore, such ordinance was treated as adding a new section 6-8 at the editor's discretion.  
Sec. 6-9. - Carports. 
(a)  Generally—Carport defined. A carport is defined as an open-sided structure which may or may not be attached to an existing structure on one end and supported by poles or decorative posts. A carport is to be used only for temporary parking of motor vehicles, trailers or boats. No carport is allowed to substitute for a garage as defined, or required by any existing ordinances. A carport, although considered a permanent structure, cannot be used for any purpose other than motor vehicle or trailer or boat parking. 
(b)  Setback requirements. No carport shall be erected closer than five feet to the front property line when measured from the longest projection of the roof line, eave, or decorative overhang; except when there is a 20-foot setback line, the five-foot requirement shall not apply. In such case, the carport shall not be extended closer than one foot from the property line. 
(c)  Building requirements. Carports may be constructed of metal and wood only and may be attached to the main structure at the innermost end with either a flat roof or a roof with a pitch. All wood carports' soffit and wood posts must be covered with non-combustible material such as Hardiplank, brick, or stucco. The carport shall not have any ceiling openings accessible for any storage area. The carport shall be supported at its outermost end by not more than two (2) metal or wood stanchions (poles) with braces anchored in a manner approved by the building official, and such poles shall not be placed closer than five (5) feet on both sides of the property; except the front of the carport roof's edge shall not be placed closer than one (1) foot from the property line. The horizontal portion of the carport framework shall not be less than eight (8) feet nor more than twelve (12) feet above grade (natural ground) elevation. The stanchions supporting the carport shall be separated by not more than twenty (20) feet and the roof overhang shall not exceed two (2) feet from the supporting stanchions on any side. No wall shall be erected or attached to any carport permitted under this section. 
(Ord. No. 2005-17, § 1, 4-19-05; Ord. No. 2009-03, § 1, 1-20-09; Ord. No. 2018-03 , § 1, 2-27-18)  
Sec. 6-10. - Contractors—Damage to water or sewer lines. 
As a condition to the permit issued to a contractor for work to be performed in the City of South Houston, Texas, Contractor shall agree in writing to repair any water or sewer line damage caused by contractor in the course of contractor's performing services within the city. 
(Ord. No. 2006-24, 7-18-06)  
Secs. 6-11—6-16. - Reserved.  
ARTICLE II. - BUILDING CODE 
 
Sec. 6-17. - Adopted. 
That certain documents, three (3) copies of which are on file in the office of the inspection department and the City of South Houston are marked and designated as the 2015 International Building Code, including Appendix Chapters A—L, as published by the International Code Council, and are hereby adopted as the code of the City of South Houston for regulating the design, construction, quality of materials, erection, installation, alteration, repair, location, relocation, replacement, addition to, use or maintenance of all structures in the City of South Houston, and providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor and each and all of the regulations, provisions, conditions and terms of such International Building Code, on file in the office of the City of South Houston, are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part hereof as if fully set out in this ordinance. Ordinance No. 2010-17 adopting an earlier version is hereby repealed. 
(Ord. No. 453, Art. I, § 1, 5-3-60; Ord. No. 906 (7-91), § 2, 7-19-91; Ord. No. 97-034, § 2, 3-25-97; Ord. No. 2002-05, §§ 1, 2, 5, 4-2-02; Ord. No. 2010-17, § 1, 9-14-10; Ord. No. 2017-32 , § 1, 7-25-17)  
Sec. 6-18. - Definitions. 
As used in the building code adopted by this article, the term "governing body" shall mean the city council of this city and the term "building official" shall mean the duly appointed building inspector of this city. 
Cross reference— Appointment and removal of building inspector, §§ 2-3, 2-5.  
Sec. 6-19. - Reserved.

Sec. 6-20. - Fees. 
Schedule of permit fees. On buildings, structures, or alterations requiring a permit, a fee shall be paid as required, in accordance with the schedule as established by the City of South Houston (Exhibit A), as amended.
