Section 4. - Pipeline information. 
The following general pipeline information shall describe the proposed two-inch pipeline that M & R Exploration Company proposes to construct across the City of South Houston: 
1)  Number of pipelines: One from the four wells located at Lot No. 8 - Block No. 36, Lot No. 14 - Block No. 64, Lot No. 9 - Block No. 70, and Lot No. 13 - Block No. 70; and then to exit points on the Westerly city limits line of the City at Sherman Street & Dakota Avenue and/or Kansas Avenue. 
2)  Size of pipelines: Either 2? and/or 4? diameter existing, and/or 2? diameter new, or a combination thereof all. To be determined after the design phase. See Exhibit "A" attachment (Exhibit "A" is not printed herein but is on file in the office of the city secretary). 
3)  Material being transported: Crude Oil and High Pressure Gas 
4)  Maximum operating pressure: Crude Oil - 35 PSI 
High Pressure Gas - 750 PSI 
5)  Maximum operating temperature: Crude Oil - 75° F 
High Pressure Gas - 90° F 
6)  There shall be no restrictions on buildings being constructed on the properties adjacent to the pipelines and R.O.W.s. 
7)  The pipeline shall be constructed, reused, operated and maintained in accordance with the latest rules and regulations of the U. S. Department of Transportation. 
8)  Pipelines shall be buried a minimum of two and five-tenths (2.5) feet deep and a maximum of four and five-tenths (4.5) feet deep, and variance only as approved by the city's consulting engineer. 
10)  Street and road crossings shall be installed by boring under them or by open cutting and replacing, as approved by the engineer for this project. Open cutting and replacing shall be by typical sections shown on the plans. 
(Ord. No. 99-010, § 1, 5-11-99; Ord. No. 2001-05, § 1, 4-3-01)  
Section 5. - Franchise fees. 
The grantee shall pay to the City of South Houston a franchise fee an initial franchise fee in the amount of five hundred dollars ($500.00), and shall thereafter pay to the city an annual fee in the amount also of five hundred dollars ($500.00), on or before the anniversary date of the final passage of this franchise.  
Section 6. - Authorization. 
The franchise herein granted shall and does hereby authorize the grantee to construct, install, lay, reuse, operate, maintain, and remove when necessary, two-inch and/or four-inch diameter pipelines on and across streets, alleys, and rights-of-way in the northwesterly portions of the City of South Houston, and being along the routes herein above generally described (to be described in exact descriptions at the end of the design phase or into part of the construction phase); and in strict accordance with the plans and specifications to be attached heretofore as Exhibit "B" at the end of the design phase or part of the construction phase; and all of which are to be filed with the city secretary and approved by the city's consulting engineer.  
Section 7. - Laws, regulations, rules and permits. 
1.  The work done by M & R Exploration Co. under the grant of authority of this franchise is and in the future, shall be subject to and governed by all present and future laws, regulations, and rules of the city, the State of Texas, and the United States of America, including any other governmental agency having jurisdiction. 
2.  M & R Exploration Co. shall obtain, at its own expense, all permits and licenses required by law, rule, regulation, ordinance, and applicable governmental requirements for as long as required.  
Section 8. - Transfer. 
No transfer of this franchise shall be effective unless it be in writing, in duplicate, signed by the transferor and by the transferee, and stating the true consideration of such transfer, and it shall be filed with the city secretary. The city's consulting engineer and the city attorney shall file his written recommendations concerning such transfer and by the recommendation of the city's consulting engineer and the city attorney, the city council must approve by motion, resolution or ordinance the application for transfer before any such transfer or attempted transfer shall be valid and have any force or effect. If not approved by the city council, the transfer or attempted transfer shall be null and void.  
Section 9. - Indemnification and save harmless clause. 
M & R Exploration Co. hereby releases, acquits, and forever discharges the city, its officers, agents, and employees, from any and all claims, demands, rights or causes or action of whatsoever character or nature arising from or by reason of any and all bodily or personal injuries, including death and mental anguish, damage to property and the consequences thereof which may be sustained by M & R Exploration Co., its employees or agents, in connection with this franchise and which are caused in whole or in part by the negligence of the city, its officers, agents, or employees. 
M & R Exploration shall keep, hold harmless, and defend the city, its officers, agents, and employees from any and all costs, liability, damage or expense of any nature and howsoever caused, claimed or recovered by anyone by reason of injury to or death of any person or persons or damage to or destruction of property caused by or resulting from the negligence of the city, its officers, agents, or employees arising in connection with M & R Exploration Co.'s franchise hereunder. It is the expressed intention of both the city and M & R Exploration Co. that the indemnity provided for in this section is indemnity by M & R Exploration Co. to indemnify and protect the city from the consequences of the negligence by sole, joint, or concurrent, active or passive. For purposes of this indemnification provision, acts and/or omissions of M & R Exploration Co.'s agents, contractors, and employees shall be considered the acts and omissions of M & R Exploration Co. The provisions of this section shall survive the termination, expiration or cancellation of this agreement.  
Section 10. - Plans (drawings) and specifications. 
1)  All work and design must be in accordance with the rules, regulations, drawings, etc., of the city. 
2)  The grantee shall submit both plans and specifications, and any required soils reports to the city. The plans shall include plan-profile sheets. 
3)  The plans and specifications, and any required soils reports, shall be submitted to the city secretary in triplicate (3 sets), and-all engineering must be signed by a licensed engineer, as licensed in the State of Texas, and all surveying must be signed by a licensed surveyor, as licensed in the State of Texas. 
4)  The plans and specifications, and any required soil reports must be approved by the city's consulting engineer. 
5)  The safety of the general public and the project shall be provided for and be the sole responsibility of, the applicant and his contractor. 
6)  All utilities, pipelines, cables and other underground facilities, as existing in the field, shall be located and [the depth] determined and shown on the plans. 
7)  All city items existing and any known proposed shall be shown on the plans. 
8)  Trench safety for all excavation and trenching, as required and necessary, shall be provided for the protection of the general public, workers, equipment, city items, etc., to the approval of the city's consulting engineer. 
9)  Proper engineering and construction practices shall be followed at all times. 
10)  All road or street crossings shall be bored or open cut and replaced, as approved by the engineer. Open cut and replaced streets shall have cement stabilized sand backfill installed from under the pipe to the bottom of the paving structure for the width of the trench, and to the approval of the city's consulting engineer. 
11)  Excavation shall be limited to what the contractor is able to cover up in a day. Any excavation left over night, over the weekend, or on holidays due to the weather or other problems, shall be either covered up and/or barricaded for the safety of others. 
12)  The proposed pipeline shall in no way hamper the existing or proposed city items, streets, water lines, sanitary sewer lines, storm sewers, or other city structures. 
13)  The grantee shall provide the necessary automatic or manual check valves or cutoff type valves, which prevent the flow of the commodity, in either direction if there should be a break or rupture within the limits of any city property within the city limits. Such valves and the location of such shall be as approved by the city's consulting engineer. 
14)  Upon completion of the design phase, the applicant shall submit a reproducible set of the final approved drawings and specifications. Upon completion of the construction of the proposed two-inch and/or four-inch diameter pipelines, the grantee shall furnish to the city a reproducible set of as-built plans accurately showing the actual location, course, alignment and depths of the pipeline within the city limits. The as-built plans shall be the approved construction drawings showing the final results and all changes or revisions due to the construction efforts. 
15)  The grantee shall construct the pipeline in strict accordance with the approved set of plans and specifications. During construction, problems and unknown conditions may require changes or revisions, and these changes or revisions will be to the written approval of the city's consulting engineer. 
16)  The grantee shall reimburse the city for any and all expenses incurred by the city for the preparation of the franchise phase, the approval process of the plans (drawings) and specifications phase, and the design phase.  
Section 11. - Inspection. 
1)  During the construction of this pipeline, M & R Exploration Company shall furnish a full time contractor superintendent, or an approved employee of M & R Exploration Company, for the duration of the work in the city limits. 
2)  The city's consulting engineer, or his designated inspector, shall personally inspect the work on a part time basis or as needed basis for the duration of the work. An inspector as provided by the city's consulting engineer shall be for reporting and inspecting the work and project only. 
3)  The city's consulting engineer shall have the responsibility of approving any and all constructions changes and revisions; and the authority to stop the construction work due to noncompliance with the plans and specifications, or the safety of the general public is endangered, or the contractor is tearing up public property, or the work is not in compliance with the best interests of the city. 
4)  All expenses incurred by the city during and for the inspection phase of the pipeline construction shall be reimbursed entirely by the grantee.  
Section 12. - Construction phase. 
1)  All construction work shall be in accordance with the city's consulting engineer's approved plans (drawings) and specifications and franchise documents. 
2)  All construction work shall be inspected by the city, which shall be by the city's consulting engineer, or his designated inspector. 
3)  Prior to construction, the grantee shall submit to the city consulting engineer the necessary information concerning their contractor to be retained for the construction of this project: 
(a)  Name, address, person in charge, [and] telephone numbers. 
(b)  Type of equipment to be used and the approximated work force. 
(c)  Construction contract times will be submitted. 
(d)  Work schedules shall be submitted. 
(e)  All other information shall be submitted to the city as requested or needed. 
4)  There shall be a pre-construction meeting between the grantee, the grantee's inspector or field manager, the city consulting engineer, the city's consulting engineer's inspector if applicable, and the contractor along with the contractor's superintendent for this project. 
5)  Prior notice of construction shall be given to the city before actual construction can begin. The city shall be given at least ten (10) days' notice of actual construction. 
6)  The contractor shall be the agent of the grantee, and the grantee shall be the sole responsible party to the city. All city notices, correspondence, orders, etc. shall be to the Grantee. The contractor can and should attend or listen to any meetings, requests, etc., but the Grantee is responsible for all aspects of this ordinance. 
7)  The grantee shall provide the city with proof of all necessary insurance certificates and bonds before any construction can begin; and all necessary insurance certificates and bonds will be as directed and approved by the city's consulting engineer and the city attorney. 
8)  The grantee shall provide routes, places to park cars, lunch areas, sanitary conditions, water, etc. for the construction workmen, all to the approval of the city. 
9)  The grantee shall provide spaces on the actual pipeline R.O.W.s for the contractors equipment, supplies, materials, tools, and work force, as approved by the city's consulting engineer. 
10)  The grantee shall not let the contractor park equipment or vehicles, store materials, or let workmen enter any adjacent citizen's private property. 
11)  The grantee shall submit to the city's consulting engineer a proposed construction route schedule for approval. The willful tearing up of city streets will not be allowed. 
12)  The grantee shall not wholly close any street or alley but shall at all times maintain a route of travel, maintain safety for the public, and maintain an area for ongoing maintenance in all alleys. 
13)  The grantee shall not store materials, place equipment, allow vehicles, nor allow any work in the adjacent ditches of belonging to the Harris County Flood Control District (HCFCD). 
14)  The proposed route or routes of the pipelines may be across existing facilities and open ditches belonging to the HCFCD. The grantee and his contractor shall notify the HCFCD of any work if required and shall have to obtain approval from the HCFCD of any such work in, over, under, or along side HCFCD ditches. 
15)  The grantee shall excavate only the area that can be covered up or refilled at the end of the work day. If excavations are left open due to problems, then they shall be covered and/or barricaded as approved by the city's consulting engineer. 
16)  The grantee shall make a sincere effort not to damage and destroy any city property and any citizen's private property during the construction work. 
17)  The grantee shall provide that the contractor provides proper and adequate trench and excavation safety in accordance with state statutes and also minimum OSHA regulations at all time during construction. 
18)  When found necessary during construction by the city's consulting engineer, the proposed pipeline shall be lowered, raised, relocated, or revised at the sole expense of the grantee. It is the purpose of this item that city improvements, changes and alterations in the existing or future city streets, street R.O.W., alleys, water lines, storm sewer lines, sanitary sewer lines, or other city structures, shall in no way be hampered by the proposed pipeline or other structures of the grantee. 
19)  The grantee shall provide boards, old tires or other protective items for the protection of existing streets during the crossing of construction equipment. 
20)  The grantee shall not stop up any existing open drainage ditches or storm sewers, and shall maintain proper drainage at all times during construction. (No materials shall be placed or stored at any time in the open drainage ditches). 
21)  The grantee shall provide proper barricades, safety, and warning devices during the construction work. 
22)  The city's consulting engineer shall have the authority, during construction, to stop the work, if the work is not in compliance with the plans and specifications, if the grantee is allowing unsafe actions either by work or to the public, if the grantee is willfully destroying or damaging city property, or if proper city standards are not followed; until such time as compliance or results are achieved. 
23)  The grantee is cautioned that in hauling excavated material or construction materials upon public streets and thoroughfares, he shall use whatever means are necessary to prevent damage to the streets, and to prevent soil, other foreign material or construction debris from littering the aforesaid streets or thoroughfares. In the event that from these haulings, the streets or thoroughfares or any other city property, become cluttered, the grantee shall remove this waste immediately without damage to city property or the traveling public. Any damage to the city streets shall be repaired by the contractor to the approval of the city's consulting engineer. 
24)  The grantee shall be responsible for the preservation of all public and private property, trees, monuments, etc., along and adjacent to the pipeline, and shall use every precaution necessary to prevent damage to streets, paving, pipes, conduits, cables, and other underground structures, and shall protect carefully from disturbance or damage all land, monuments, and property marks. When or where any direct or indirect damage or injury is done to city or public or private property by or on account of any act, omission, neglect, or, misconduct in the execution of the construction work or in consequence of the nonexecution thereof on the part of the grantee, he shall restore at his own expense such property to a condition similar or equal to that existing before such damage or injury was done by repairing, rebuilding, or otherwise restoring same, or the grantee shall make good such damage or injury in an acceptable manner. 
25)  Sub-surface conditions. It is not represented nor is it possible to determine that all existing city underground utilities and other firms underground structures can be shown on the plans. When existing unknown underground items constitute an obstruction to the construction, grantee shall immediately notify the city's consulting engineer, who will determine the course of action to be taken. Any damage to any existing underground facilities will be repaired at the grantee's sole expense to the satisfaction of the owner of the facility. No claims or compensation will be allowed against the city for the cost involved in making the changes or relocations referred to herein. 
26)  The grantee shall notify any and all known utility companies or firms whose facilities will be affected by the pipeline construction, in advance, so that their representatives can observe the construction activity affecting their lines and facilities. 
27)  Sequence of work (determined at the pre-construction meeting): 
(a)  The grantee shall prepare and submit to the city engineer, for approval, a schedule showing each major construction activity and the proposed time interval. No construction will be permitted until such a schedule is approved in writing by the city engineer. 
(b)  The construction schedule shall show all detours, construction traffic routing, actual work areas and time, estimated work time in the city limits, special conditions, etc. 
28)  All completed work shall be for the approval of the city's consulting engineer. 
29)  If flagmen are required during the construction of this project, then it is the request of the City of South Houston that the grantee shall use off duty personnel of the City of South Houston Police Department, or he can use the approved contractor personnel with approved colored vests and flags. 
30)  Final clean-up: 
(a)  Upon completion of the work and before final inspection by the city's consulting engineer, the grantee shall clean, remove rubbish and temporary structures from all city and private properties, restore in an acceptable manner all property which has been damaged during the prosecution of the work, and leave the city and private properties in a neat and presentable condition throughout. This item shall also apply to the applicant's properties in the city limits. 
(b)  The city's consulting engineer shall inspect the pipeline project after clean-up for final approval and any final repair work. After final clean-up and final repair work, the city's consulting engineer shall issue a written acceptance of the project for the city. 
31)  The grantee shall reimburse the city for any and all expenses incurred by the city for the construction phase of this ordinance.  
Section 13. - Safety and understanding. 
Construction safety. The grantee and his contractor shall be solely responsible for the safety of the work and facilities, themselves, their employees and other persons, as well as for the protection of the safety of the improvements being constructed and the property of themselves or any other person(s), as a result of the construction operations hereunder. 
Franchise safety. The grantee shall be solely responsible for the safety of all of the improvements, facilities, system, etc. covered under this said franchise, himself, his employees and other persons, as well as for the protection of the safety of all items and systems covered under the said franchise and the property of himself or any other person, as a result of the franchise operations hereunder granted. 
Grantee understanding. The grantee, and his contractor as applicable, shall at all times remain independent contractors, solely responsible for the work, operations, and safety and the manner and methods of completing, operating, maintaining, and repairing the franchise system, so long as such methods do not adversely affect the completed improvements and franchise facilities, the city being interested only in the results obtained and conformity of such completed improvements and franchise system to the plans, specifications, and franchise documents.  
Section 14. - Repair work. 
1)  During construction the grantee shall be responsible for the actual repair of any broken city utility lines in a very timely manner. If the grantee does not repair any damaged city utility line in a reasonable period so that necessary city services are maintained, then the city shall repair the damaged line with its own forces or by another contractor. The cost of this repair work shall be for the direct expense of the grantee. 
2)  If the grantee fails to adequately barricade or place sufficient warning devices at locations of the work area where it is an unsafe condition to the general public, then the city shall be reimbursed for any expense in providing adequate warning devices. 
3)  After construction, any damage to existing city properties, as roadways, ditches, storm sewers, sanitary sewers, water lines, manholes, bridges, signs, etc. shall be repaired to the state of their original condition, as approved by the city's consulting engineer, and the cost of such shall be for the direct expense of the grantee. 
4)  Failure to reimburse the city for any expense or repair cost or the actual repair of damaged city property, shall result in the bonding or surety company making these costs good. If the grantee or the bonding company refuse to reimburse the city for any repair costs or expense, then this franchise ordinance shall become null and void. 
5)  The grantee shall refill all excavations, including the repaving of pavement excavations and cuts, made by it within the R.O.W. of any street or alley in the constructing, operating, maintaining, or removing of such pipeline or any part thereof; and if after once refilling such excavation the earth or repaving within such excavated area settles so as to leave a depression, the grantee shall make further necessary fills from time to time as ordered by the city's consulting engineer, and the cost of such shall be for the direct expense of the grantee.  
Section 15. - Future city improvements. 
If in the construction of future city improvements they conflict with the actual location of these pipelines in a vertical or horizontal plane, then the grantee shall raise, lower, or move this pipeline at his expense. This item applies to all city-owned properties within the city limits.  
Section 16. - Maintenance. 
The grantee shall maintain these lines in good order and condition for the duration of the ordinance period. The grantee shall maintain also in a timely interval or period the repair of this line due to any complaints of leaking, etc. by the city. Also, any or all repair and maintenance work shall be done after just notifying the city of such work and as approved by the city's consulting engineer. All repair and maintenance work shall be for the direct expense of the grantee. Any leaks, leaking, etc. of the grantee's lines shall be cleaned up in a timely manner, including all soils and other items that such spillage contaminates, and all at the sole expense of the grantee.  
Section 17. - Grantee acceptance. 
The grantee shall file its written acceptance of this franchise with the city secretary of the City of South Houston within thirty (30) days from the date of the city council passage hereof, and shall thereupon be bound by all of the terms and conditions hereof. The franchise herein granted shall commence and inure to the benefit of the grantee, effective immediately, with the filing of such written acceptance hereof by the grantee. 
PASSED AND APPROVED THIS 1st DAY OF MARCH 1994. 
	 DENNIS CORDRAY       
 MAYOR OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON 
ATTEST: 	
 YOUNG LORFING       
 CITY SECRETARY 	
CITY SEAL: 	
  
ARTICLE VI. - ARCO PIPELINE COMPANY FRANCHISE[6] 
ORDINANCE NO. 638 
AN ORDINANCE GRANTING TO ARCO PIPELINE COMPANY, THE RIGHT, PRIVILEGE AND FRANCHISE TO LAY, REPLACE, MAINTAIN, OPERATE AND REMOVE A THIRTY-SIX INCH (36?) PIPELINE IN THE CORPORATE LIMITS OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, IN ACCORDANCE WITH PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS HERETOFORE FILED WITH CITY HALL FOR THE FIFTY (50) YEAR TERM HEREIN PROVIDED; PRESCRIBING THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS UNDER WHICH SAID RIGHT, PRIVILEGE, AND FRANCHISE IS GRANTED; AND PROVIDING FOR THE ACCEPTANCE THEREOF. 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON: 

Footnotes: 
--- (6) --- 
Editor's note— Printed herein is an ordinance granting a franchise to Arco Pipeline Company, adopted Nov. 1, 1977. Amendments to the franchise are indicated by parenthetical history notes following amended provisions. The absence of a history note indicates that the provision remains unchanged from the original ordinance. Obvious misspellings and punctuation errors have been corrected without notation. For stylistic purposes, a uniform system of headings, catchlines, capitalization, citation to state statutes, and expression of numbers in text has been used to conform to the Code of Ordinances. Additions made for clarity are indicated by brackets. 
Cross reference— Seaway Pipeline Company Assignment, App. B, Art. VII. 
 
Section 1. - Grant of franchise; description of centerline. 
The City Council of the City of South Houston, Texas, hereinafter referred to as "city," does hereby, subject to all of the provisions hereof, grant to Arco Pipeline Company, hereinafter referred to as "grantee," for a term of fifty (50) years from the date of this ordinance, and subject to the terms and conditions hereof, the right, privilege, and franchise to lay, replace, maintain, operate and remove a 36-inch crude oil pipeline within the city limits of the City of South Houston, generally entering the city limits at a point where the below-described Rancho Pipeline Company's fee property intersects the south boundary line of the city, the centerline description of said pipeline being as follows: 
Beginning at a point on the south corporate boundary line of the City of South Houston, Texas, (being located within the right-of-way of Genoa Street, sometimes called Pecan Street) where Rancho Pipeline Company's fee property crosses Genoa Street at a point 5.3 feet westerly of Rancho Pipeline System's (formerly Shell Pipeline Corporation's) existing 24-inch pipeline; thence, northerly at a point 5.3 feet westerly from Rancho Pipeline System's 24-inch pipeline through the H. C. Burnett Survey Abstract 1066 and the southerly portion of the H. T. & B. R. R. Company Survey, Abstract 393 to right-of-way line of Kolb Street established as the northerly city limits of South Houston.  
Section 2. - Terms and conditions. 
Each of the following terms, provisions and conditions is a material part of the franchise herein granted, and grantee by its acceptance of this franchise agrees to perform each and every provision and condition: 
(a)  The franchise herein granted shall and does hereby authorize the grantee to run a thirty-six-inch pipeline across and underneath the public streets and easements from its entrance as aforesaid into the city and continuing across the City of South Houston as aforesaid to its exit at the northerly city limit line, upon the approval of the building inspector as to the points at which the pipeline will cross or run along or underneath any street or streets and right-of-way or rights-of-way within the City of South Houston in accordance to plans and specifications heretofore filed with the city secretary and approved by the city engineer. 
(b)  When found necessary by the city council or building inspector, any such line or other structures shall be lowered [or] relocated, upon written request by said building inspector at the sole expense of the grantee. It is the purpose of this subsection that improvements, changes and alterations in either existing or future streets, street right-of-way, water, sanitary, sewer, or storm sewers shall in no way be hampered by the line or other structures of the grantee. 
(c)  The grantee shall pay to the City of South Houston an initial franchise fee in the amount of two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) and shall thereafter pay to said city an annual fee in the amount of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per year, payable annually in advance, on or before the anniversary date of the final passage of the ordinance granting this franchise; provided, that the grantee may at its election and option pay in advance at the time the initial franchise fee is paid the aggregate amount of the twenty-five dollar ($25.00) annual fees to be thereafter payable for the full term covered hereby and if such advance payment is made of such annual fees, no further annual fees shall be payable during the life and term of this franchise. 
(d)  Grantee shall save the city harmless from and against all liability for injury or damage to any person or persons or property caused by the construction, maintenance, operation, repair or removal of any part or all of such pipeline within the right-of-way of any street or alley of the city. Grantee shall pay to the city all damages caused to the city of any of its agencies by the construction, maintenance, operation, repair or removal of such pipeline or any part thereof. 
(e)  Grantee shall refill (including the repaving of any cut in any pavement) all excavations made by it within the right-of-way of any street or alley in the constructing, operating, maintaining, or removing of such pipeline or any part thereof; and if after once refilling such excavation the earth within such excavated area settles so as to leave a depression, the grantee shall make further necessary fills from time to time as ordered by the city's building inspector or by the city council. Grantee will repair all portions of any street or alley across or along which its said line is laid and place the same in as good a state of repair and condition as they were in at the time of construction, repair or removal was commenced, such repairs to be the satisfaction of the city council. 
(f)  All construction contemplated by grantee, including all work of repairing or refilling, shall be done under plans and specifications thereof approved by the building inspector and subject to his approval of the completed work; and any excavation in or along any such street or alley shall be replaced with materials of the same kind as those removed unless the city's such building inspector approves of some other type of fill or material. Grantee shall notify the city's building inspector before commencing at any time an excavation in any portion of any street or alley and shall not wholly close any street or alley but shall at all times maintain a route of travel along and within such roadway area which shall include any sidewalk area, except that in cases of emergency the city's such building inspector, the mayor, or the city council may authorize a temporary closing of any street, alley, or sidewalk in order to take care of any break or leakage in the pipeline if in the opinion of the city's such building inspector, the mayor or the city council, such closing is necessary to protect the safety of the public. 
(g)  If the grantee fails to commence or thereafter to diligently prosecute any such repair, refilling or other work so required to be done by it within a reasonable time after being notified thereof by the city's building inspector, the city may cause such work to be done at the expense of the grantee and may recover all such expenses from the grantee, together with all costs and reasonable attorney's fees. 
(h)  The grantee shall provide the necessary automatic pressure release (cutoff) valves which prevent the flow of the commodity, in either direction if there should be any break or rupture within the right-of-way limits of any street or public property; such valves must meet with the approval of the building inspector. 
(i)  Upon completion of the laying of the initial pipeline, grantee shall furnish to the city a building plan and drawing accurately showing the actual location, course and alignment of the pipeline, said plans shall consist not only of the plan but also of a suitable profile accurately showing the location of all streets or alleys across or along which the pipeline was laid as well as the location of any other pipeline, utility line or other underground facility in close proximity of said pipeline. 
(j)  All notices to grantee shall be given as follows: 
Arco Pipeline Company 
P.O. Box 22146 
Houston, Texas 77027 
(k)  Initial construction and installation of such pipeline will be in accordance to the plans and specifications heretofore submitted to, and approved by, the city. 
(l)  The city may, at any such time deemed advisable by the city, retain a professional engineer to inspect in-progress construction by grantee, or to examine any plans and specifications submitted by grantee, to city concerning construction proposed by grantee, and grantee shall pay and reimburse the city for the cost of such services within ten (10) days following notice of same given by city. With reference to the inspection of in-progress work, should such engineer be of the opinion that same is not in compliance with the plans and specifications, or the city permit relating to same, he shall have the authority to stop the work in progress until such time as compliance is achieved. This provision shall be in addition to other provisions contained herein. 
(m)  Pipeline will be used for the transportation of crude oil. 
(n)  Maximum operating pressure will be five hundred (500) pounds per square inch. 
(o)  Maximum operating temperature will be ambient. 
(p)  In addition to any provision herein contained, pipeline will be constructed and operating in accordance with rules and regulations of U. S. Department of Transportation. 
(q)  Prior notice of construction will be given to city before actual construction in the city. 
(r)  All street crossings will be installed by boring under them. 
(s)  Pipeline will have adequate cathodic protection as defined by the U.S. Department of Transportation.  
Section 3. - Transfer of franchise. 
No transfer of this franchise shall be effective unless it be in writing, in duplicate, signed by the transferor and by the transferee, and stating the true consideration of such transfer, and it shall be filed with the city secretary. The city engineer shall file his written recommendation concerning such transfer and the recommendation of the city engineer, the city council must approve by motion, resolution or ordinance the application for transfer before any such transfer or attempted transfer shall be valid and have any force or effect. If not approved by the city council, the transfer or attempted transfer shall be null and void. 
Cross reference— Seaway Pipeline Company Assignment, App. B, Art. VII.  
Section 4. - Acceptance of franchise. 
The grantee shall file its written acceptance of this franchise with the city secretary of the City of South Houston within thirty (30) days from the date of the passage hereof and shall thereupon be bound by all of the terms and conditions hereof. The franchise herein granted shall commence and inure to the benefit of the grantee, effective immediately, with the filing of such written acceptance hereof by grantee. The grantee shall not commence any work or construction of any type within the right-of-way limits of any street or public property until the final passage and acceptance of this franchise. Also made a part of this agreement shall be the request of the City of South Houston that the grantee shall use personnel of the City of South Houston Police Department to give proper protection to all concerned during the construction and laying of this line. 
PASSED ON FIRST READING by the City Council of the City of South Houston, Texas, in regular meeting in the City Hall this 1st day of November, A.D., 1977. 
/s/ Gene Kitch       
Gene Kitch, Mayor of the 
City of South Houston, Texas 
ATTEST: 
/s/ Toy Ann Harp, Acting City Secretary 
LaNelle Chafin, City Secretary 
TO THE HONORABLE MAYOR AND CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON: 
The Company for itself, its successors and assigns, hereby accepts the attached ordinance and agrees to be bound by all of its terms and provisions. 
ARCO PIPELINE COMPANY

I, LANELLE CHAFIN, the duly appointed, qualified and acting City Secretary of the City of South Houston, Texas, hereby certify that the above and foregoing Acceptance was received and filed in the office of the City Secretary of the City of South Houston on the 1st day of November, 1977. 
EXECUTED under my hand and the official seal of the City of South Houston, Texas, at said City, this 3rd day of November, A.D., 1977.

ARTICLE VII. - SEAWAY PIPELINE COMPANY ASSIGNMENT[7] 
ORDINANCE NO. 96-028 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING ORDINANCE NO. 638 TO SUBSTITUTE SEAWAY PIPELINE CO. FOR ARCO PIPELINE CO. AS THE HOLDER OF THE 50 YEAR PIPELINE FRANCHISE GRANTED NOVEMBER 1, 1977 UNDER THE SAME TERMS AND CONDITIONS BUT WITH A MORE SPECIFIC LEGAL DESCRIPTION. 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON: 

Footnotes: 
--- (7) --- 
Editor's note— Printed herein is an ordinance granting the Seaway Pipeline Assignment, adopted Nov. 12, 1996. The absence of a history note indicates that the provision remains unchanged from the original ordinance. Obvious misspellings and punctuation errors have been corrected without notation. For stylistic purposes, a uniform system of headings, catchlines, capitalization, citation to state statutes, and expression of numbers in text has been used to conform to the Code of Ordinances. Additions made for clarity are indicated by brackets. 
 
Section 1. - Approval of assignment. 
Ordinance No. 638 was passed on November 1, 1977. It granted Arco Pipeline Company (hereafter "ARCO") a fifty-year franchise for pipeline purposes. ARCO has assigned its interests in that franchise to Seaway Pipeline Company, subject to city approval. City approves the assignment of the balance of the term of the franchise and approves the assignee as the holder of the franchise for the duration of the franchise. The terms and conditions of the original ordinance (Ordinance No. 638 shall remain the same for the new holder of the franchise save and except the description of the centerline for the north-south pipeline corridor along 7th Street shall be the centerline described in Exhibit "A," two pages in length dated August 20, 1996, prepared and certified by Fred P. Langham R.P.L.S. and reviewed and approved by the city engineer. A copy is attached as Exhibit "A." 
Editor's note— Exhibit A has not been included herein but can be found on file with the city.  
Section 2. - Terms and conditions. 
The terms and conditions of Ordinance No. 638 shall remain the same as in the original ordinance save and except there is attached hereto as "Exhibit A" and incorporated herein by reference a revised and improved legal description of the pipeline corridor authorized.  
Section 3. - Acceptance of franchise. 
The grantee shall file its written acceptance of this franchise with the city secretary in compliance with the provisions of section 4 of Ordinance 638 within sixty (60) days from the date of passage hereof and shall thereupon be bound by all of the terms and conditions hereof. The effective date of this ordinance shall be the date that said written acceptance is filed with the city secretary. The acceptance shall not be filed until all costs to the city have been paid by Seaway Pipeline Company as required in section 4 herein.  
Section 4. - Costs. 
This action shall be at no cost to the city. The cost for engineering review was six hundred dollars ($600.00), payable to R.W. Patrick and Associates, P.O. Box 928, South Houston, Texas, 77587. The fees for legal services (review and drafting of the documents of approval) were three hundred seventy-five dollars ($375.00) payable to Gregg, Mieszkuc, Lewis and Daughtry, P.C., 17044 El Camino Real, Houston, Texas, 77058. Seaway Pipeline Company shall pay same promptly. 
PASSED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS in a regular meeting on the 12th day of November, 1996. 
/s/ Cipriano Romero 
CIPRIANO ROMERO, Mayor of the 
City of South Houston, Texas 
Attest: 
/s/ Barbara Bigham 
BARBARA BIGHAM, City Secretary 
City of South Houston, Texas  
ARTICLE VIII. - CENTERPOINT ENERGY ENTEX 
ORDINANCE NO. 2004-26 
AN ORDINANCE GRANTING CENTERPOINT ENERGY ENTEX, A DIVISION OF CENTERPOINT ENERGY RESOURCES CORP., ITS SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS, THE RIGHT, PRIVILEGE AND FRANCHISE FOR A PERIOD OF TWENTY-FIVE (25) YEARS TO CONSTRUCT, LAY, MAINTAIN, OPERATE, EXTEND, REMOVE, REPLACE AND REPAIR A SYSTEM OF PIPELINES, GAS MAINS, LATERALS AND ATTACHMENTS AND ALL DESIRABLE INSTRUMENTALITIES IN, UNDER, OVER, ACROSS AND ALONG ANY AND ALL STREETS, AVENUES, PARKWAYS, SQUARES, ALLEYS AND ALL OTHER PUBLIC PLACES IN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, HARRIS COUNTY, TEXAS FOR THE PURPOSE OF TRANSPORTING, DISTRIBUTING, SUPPLYING AND SELLING GAS (NATURAL AND/OR ARTIFICIAL AND/OR MIXED) FOR HEATING, LIGHTING, POWER, AND FOR ALL OTHER PURPOSES FOR WHICH GAS MAY BE USED, TO THE SAID MUNICIPALITY AND ITS INHABITANTS AND OTHERS; PROVIDING CONDITIONS CONTROLLING THE USE OF PUBLIC THOROUGHFARES AND EXTENSIONS THEREIN; ESTABLISHING STANDARDS OF SERVICE; PROVIDING FOR PAYMENT OF THREE PERCENT (3%) OF THE GROSS RECEIPTS FROM THE SALE OF GAS TO RESIDENTIAL AND SMALL COMMERCIAL CUSTOMERS WITHIN SAID MUNICIPALITY; PROVIDING FOR ACCEPTANCE; PROVIDING A SEVERABILITY CLAUSE; MAKING MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS; AND REPEALING ALL ORDINANCES IN CONFLICT HEREWITH. 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS: 
SECTION 1. The City of South Houston, Harris County, Texas, (herein called "Grantor") does hereby grant unto CenterPoint Energy Entex, a division of CenterPoint Energy Resources Corp., its successors and assigns (herein called "Grantee") the right, privilege, and franchise to construct, lay, maintain, operate, use, extend, remove, replace and repair in, under, over, across, and along any and all of the present and future streets, avenues, parkways, squares, alleys, thoroughfares, roads, highways, sidewalks, viaducts, bridges, streams, public grounds, public properties, and other public places in South Houston, Texas, and in all tracts, territories, and areas hereafter annexed to or acquired by and placed within the corporate boundaries of said municipality, a system, of pipes, pipelines, gas mains, laterals, conduits, feeders, regulators, meters, fixtures, connections, and attachments and other desirable instrumentalities and appurtenances necessary or proper, for the purpose of transporting, distributing, supplying and selling gas (natural and/or artificial and/or mixed) for heating, lighting, power and for any other purpose for which gas may now or hereafter be used, in and to said municipality and its inhabitants or any other person or persons within or outside the corporate boundaries of said municipality. 
SECTION 2. Grantee's property shall be so constructed and maintained as not to interfere unreasonably with traffic over the public thoroughfares of said municipality and the same shall be laid in accordance with the lines, grades, and conditions established by Grantor prior to and during the term of the franchise. Within the streets or other public ways of the City, the location and route of all mains, pipes and piping and other fittings or fixtures, shall be subject to the reasonable and proper regulation, control and direction of the Mayor or his delegate, which regulation and control shall include, but not by way of limitation, the right to require in writing the relocation of Company facilities at Company's cost within the streets or other public ways whenever such shall be necessary on account of the widening, change of grade, relocation, or other city construction within such streets or public ways. 
The surface of any public road, highway, street, lane, alley, or other public place disturbed by Company in laying, constructing, maintaining, operating, using, extending, removing, replacing, or repairing its piping system shall be restored immediately after the completion of the work and maintained to the satisfaction of the Mayor or his delegate for one (1) year from the date of completion of said work, after which time responsibility for the maintenance shall become the duty of the City. No public road, highway, street, lane, alley, or other public place shall be encumbered by construction, maintenance or removal work by Company for a longer period than shall be necessary to execute such work. If there is in the opinion of the City Council an unreasonable delay by the Company in restoring and maintaining streets, highways, parks and alleys after excavation, repairs and extensions have been made, the City shall have the right without further notice to restore or repair same and require the Company to pay the reasonable cost of so restoring or repairing them. 
SECTION 3. The service furnished hereunder to said municipality and its inhabitants shall be first-class in all respects considering all circumstances and shall be subject to such reasonable rules and regulations as Grantee may make from time to time. Grantee may require reasonable security for the payment of its bills. 
SECTION 4. Grantee at its own expense shall run or extend not more than one hundred (100) feet of pipe, not to exceed a diameter of two (2) inches, in order to bring gas service to the property line of each additional customer. 
SECTION 5. In consideration of the rights and privileges herein granted, Grantee agrees to pay to the Grantor annually during the continuance of this franchise a sum of money equal to three percent (3%) of the gross receipts for received by the Grantee from the sale of gas to residential and small commercial customers within the corporate limits of the Grantor. Payments hereunder shall be calculated on the basis of gross receipts from the sale of gas to residential and small commercial customers within the corporate limits of Grantor and shall be payable for the preceding year on or before the first (1st) day of March of the year for which payment is made following the effective date of this franchise and each and every year thereafter. Upon receipt of the above amount of money, the City Secretary shall deliver to Grantee a receipt for such amount. 
Upon request of the Grantor, Grantee shall present to it any and all records, accounts and books for inspection relative to the gross receipts of Grantee within the corporate limits of the Grantor. 
The consideration hereinabove set forth shall be paid and received in lieu of any license, charge, fee, street or alley rental or other character of charge for use and occupancy for the streets, alleys and public places within Grantor, and in lieu of any pipe tax or inspection fee or tax, but shall not in anywise increase or diminish Grantee's obligation to pay the Grantor ad valorem taxes or anywise interfere with collection thereof. 
Any special taxes, rentals or other charges accruing after the effective date of this franchise, under the terms of any preexisting ordinance or imposed upon Grantee by subsequent action of the Grantor shall, when paid to the Grantor, be applied as a credit to the amount owed to the Grantor under the terms of this franchise agreement. 
Any payment made by Grantee pursuant to this ordinance shall be deemed final and correct as to both Grantor and Grantee unless questioned within two (2) years after the date of such payment. 
SECTION 6. If the Legislature of the State of Texas amends the ceiling on utility gross receipts payments to municipalities established by Tex. Tax Code §182.025, then Grantor may prospectively change the percentage of Grantee's gross receipts payable to Grantor under Section 5 of this franchise to the level established by such amendment; provided, however, that such change in the percentage of Grantee's gross receipts payable to Grantor shall not become effective unless and until Grantor shall have approved and authorized rate schedules acceptable to Grantee which will permit Grantee to fully recover through its rates effective within the corporate limits of Grantor any increase in amounts payable to Grantor resulting from such change. 
SECTION 7. Grantee shall hold Grantor harmless from all expenses or liability for any unlawful or negligent act of Grantee hereunder. 
SECTION 8. Nothing herein contained shall ever be held or considered as conferring upon Grantee and its successors and assigns any exclusive rights or privileges of any nature whatsoever. 
SECTION 9. All ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed. 
SECTION 10. Provided Grantee files a written acceptance of this franchise with Grantor within one hundred-twenty (120) days after final passage of this Ordinance, this franchise shall take effect and continue and remain in effect for a primary term of twenty-five (25) years from and after the date of this Ordinance; and, at the end of the primary term, this franchise shall automatically renew itself for successive five (5) year periods unless Grantee or Grantor shall provide written notice to the contrary to the other at least ninety (90) days prior to the expiration of the primary term or any succeeding five (5) year renewal term. 
SECTION 11. If any provision, section, subsection, sentence, clause, or phrase of this ordinance is for any reason held to be unconstitutional, void, or invalid (or for any reason unenforceable), the validity of the remaining portions of this ordinance shall not be affected thereby, it being the intent of the Grantor in adopting this ordinance that no portion hereof or provision or regulation contained herein shall become inoperative or fail by reason of any unconstitutionality or invalidity of any other portion, provisions or regulation, and to this end, all provisions of this ordinance are declared to be severable. 
PASSED AND APPROVED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, ON THIS THE 17th DAY OF AUGUST 2004. 
	      ELOISE SMITH, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas 
 	 
ATTEST: 
      SYLVIA IBARRA, 
      CITY SECRETARY City of South Houston, Texas 	
 	 
 
ARTICLE IX. - REPUBLIC WASTE SERVICES, INC. 
ORDINANCE NO. 2002-28 
AN ORDINANCE GRANTING A FRANCHISE TO REPUBLIC WASTE SERVICES, IN., ITS SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS TO OPERATE A SOLID WASTE COLLECTION SERVICE IN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON; SETTING FORTH CONDITIONS ACCOMPANYING THE GRANTING OF THIS FRANCHISE; CONTAINING A SEVERABILITY CLAUSE AND PROVIDING AN EFFECTIVE DATE 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS: 
 
Section 1. - Definitions. 
For the purpose of this Ordinance, the following terms, phrases, words and their derivatives shall have the meaning given herein, when not inconsistent with the context, words used in the present tense include the future, words in the plural number include the singular number, and words in the singular number include the plural number. 
(a)  City is the City of South Houston, Texas. 
(b)  Council is the City Council of South Houston, Texas. 
(c)  Solid Waste, whenever used in this Ordinance, shall have the definition as set forth in Chapter 10 of the Code of Ordinances of the City of South Houston, as amended. 
(d)  Grantee is Republic Waste Services, Inc. 
(e)  Person is any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation or organization of any kind.  
Section 2. - Grant of exclusive authority. 
(a)  There is hereby granted by the City to the Grantee, the exclusive right and privilege to collect and dispose of Solid Waste (refuse) for the City of South Houston, except for temporary use of roll-off containers, all as set out in that one certain contract between Grantee and City as passed and approved by the City Council on November 19, 2002, and to use and occupy the streets, alleys and public ways for the purposes set forth therein.  
Section 3. - Compliance with applicable laws and regulations. 
The Grantee shall, at all times during the life of this franchise, be subject to all lawful exercise of its police power by the City.  
Section 4. - Duration of franchise. 
This franchise ordinance shall remain in full force and effect for a period of five years, but shall be subject to optional renewal by the City for additional one-year extensions thereafter.  
Section 5. - Liability and indemnification. 
(a)  The Grantee shall indemnify and hold the City harmless from any liability, cost, damage and expense of every character arising out of, or in any manner resulting from or contributed to by, any wrongful or negligent act or omission of Grantee, its agents, servants or employees in the maintenance and operation of its facilities in the City or in the exercise of any right or privilege hereunder. 
(b)  The Grantee shall maintain, and by its acceptance of this franchise specifically agrees that it will maintain throughout the term of this franchise, liability insurance insuring the City, as provided in the aforesaid contract. Evidence of such insurance coverage shall be submitted to the City.  
Section 6. - Forfeitures or transfer of franchise. 
(a)  If the Grantee shall violate any of the terms or provisions of this franchise and should the Grantee continue to violate same for a period of thirty (30) days after Grantee shall have been notified in writing by the City by notice mailed to the Grantee's address furnished the City by Grantee, to desist from such violation so specified, then the City may terminate and cancel this franchise; provided, however, that the City shall not cancel this franchise if the Grantee is without fault as to the violation; and further provided that this franchise may not be terminated and canceled until after the grantee first has been provided with adequate opportunity to be heard before the City Council, and then only by ordinance duly adopted by the City Council. It is further provided, however, that should the Grantee be adjudged a bankrupt, then the City, after sixty (60) days written notice to the Grantee, may, if it so desires, terminate and cancel this franchise. 
(b)  The Grantee shall not sell, lease, assign or transfer this franchise without the prior written approval of the City, which approval will not be reasonably withheld; provided, however, that this franchise may be assigned by the Grantee as security for debt without approval by the City.  
Section 7. - Rates. 
Rates set by the franchise holder shall be listed with the City and available for inspection by the public.  
Sec. 8. - Payment to the City. 
During the lifetime of this franchise, the Grantee shall pay to the City an annual sum of five percent of the gross fees collected from users of its services in the City. The franchise holder shall file quarterly reports with the City showing its receipts and pay to the City with such report the amount of franchise fee due.  
Section 9. - Acceptance of franchise. 
Within thirty (30) days from the effective date of this ordinance, Grantee shall file its written acceptance of this ordinance and franchise with the City Secretary, or else this ordinance shall be null and void. Upon this written acceptance by Grantee, this ordinance and franchise shall constitute a contract between the City and Grantee and shall be binding upon both. Such acceptance shall reflect Grantee's mailing address and Grantee agrees to notify the City of any change of mailing address.  
Section 10. - Separability. 
That the City Council of the City of South Houston, Texas, does hereby declare that if any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause, phrase, word or portion of this ordinance is declared invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction, the City Council would have passed and ordained any and all remaining portions of this ordinance without the inclusion of that portion or portions which may be so found to be unconstitutional or invalid and declares that its intent is to make no portion of this ordinance dependent upon the validity of any other portion thereof, and that all said remaining portions shall continue in full force and effect.  
Section 11. - Effective date. 
That this ordinance and the rules, regulations, provisions, requirements, orders and matters established and adopted hereby shall take effect and be in full force and effect from and after the date of its final passage and adoption. 
PASSED AT A REGULAR MEETING OF THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, HELD ON THE 19th DAY OF NOVEMBER 2002. 
	/s/ Eloise Smith 
      ELOISE SMITH, MAYOR 
      CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS 
 	 
ATTEST: 
/s/ Susan Engel 
      SUSAN ENGEL, 
      CITY SECRETARY 
      CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS 	
 	 
 
ARTICLE X. - PRI SERVICES, INC. 
ORDINANCE NO. 2002-29 
AN ORDINANCE GRANTING A FRANCHISE TO PRI SERVICES, INC., ITS SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS TO OPERATE A SOLID WASTE COLLECTION SERVICE IN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON USING ROLL-OFF CONTAINERS IN TEMPORARY LOCATIONS; SETTING FORTH CONDITIONS ACCOMPANYING THE GRANTING OF THIS FRANCHISE; CONTAINING A SEVERABILITY CLAUSE AND PROVIDING AN EFFECTIVE DATE. 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS: 
 
Section 1. - Short title and definitions. 
This Ordinance shall be known and may be cited as the "PRI Franchise Ordinance". For the purposes of the Ordinance the following terms, phrases, words and their derivations shall have the meaning given herein. When not inconsistent with the context, words used in the present tense include the future, words in the plural number include the singular number, and words in the singular number include the plural number. 
(a)  City is the City of South Houston, Texas. 
(b)  Council is the City Council of South Houston, Texas. 
(c)  Solid Waste, whenever used in this Ordinance, shall mean dirt, rocks, and debris resulting from the construction, reconstruction or repair of buildings and other earthen, wooden, masonry, or metal waste materials collected in Roll Off Containers. 
(d)  Grantee is PRI Services Inc. 
(e)  Person is any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation or organization of any kind. 
(f)  Roll-off Containers shall mean steel containers positioned temporarily at a jobsite for removal of Solid Waste from the jobsite, which shall be located there only so long as the job continues.  
Section 2. - Grant of nonexclusive authority. 
(a)  There is hereby granted by the city to the company, the right and privilege to use and occupy the streets, alleys, public ways and places for the purposes herein set forth. 
(b)  The right to use and occupy said streets, alleys, public ways and places for the purposes herein set forth shall not be exclusive and the city reserves the right to grant the use of the alleys, streets, public ways and places to any person at any time during the period of this agreement.  
Section 3. - Compliance with applicable laws and regulations. 
The grantee shall, at all times during the life of this franchise, be subject to all lawful exercise of its police power by the City.  
Section 4. - Duration of franchise. 
This franchise ordinance shall remain in full force and effect for a period of five (5) years but shall be subject to renewal by the city for an additional one-year period, not to exceed a total of six (6) years, including the initial five-year period.  
Section 5. - Liability and indemnification. 
(a)  The grantee shall indemnify and hold the city harmless from any liability, cost, damage and expense of every character arising or in any manner resulting from or contributed to by any wrongful or negligent act or omission of grantee, its agents, servants or employees in the maintenance and operation of its facilities in the city or in the exercise of any right or privilege hereunder. 
(b)  The grantee shall maintain, and by its acceptance of this franchise specifically agrees, that it will maintain throughout the term of this franchise, liability insurance insuring the city and the grantee in the minimum amounts of: 
(1)  One hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) for bodily injury or death to any one person with the limit of three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000) for bodily injury or death from any one accident; 
(2)  One hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) for property damage resulting from any one accident; 
(3)  Evidence of such insurance coverage shall be submitted to the city.  
Section 6. - Forfeitures or transfer of franchise. 
(a)  If the grantee shall violate any of the terms or provisions of this franchise, and should the grantee continue to violate same for a period of thirty (30) days after grantee shall have been notified in writing by the city by notice mailed to the grantee's address furnished city by grantee to desist from such violation so specified, then the city may terminate and cancel this franchise; provided, however, that the city shall not cancel this franchise if the grantee is without fault as to the violation; and further provided, that this franchise may not be terminated and canceled until after the grantee first has been provided with adequate opportunity to be heard before the city council, and then only by ordinance duly adopted by the city council. It is further provided, however, that should the grantee be adjudged a bankrupt, then the city, after sixty (60) days' written notice to the grantee, may, if it so desires, terminate and cancel this franchise. 
(b)  The grantee shall not sell, lease, assign or transfer this franchise without the prior written approval of the city, which approval will not be unreasonably withheld; provided, however, that this franchise may be assigned by the grantee as security for debt without approval by the city.  
Section 7. - Rates. 
Rates set by the franchise holder shall be listed with the city and available for inspection by the public.  
Section 8. - Payment to the city. 
During the lifetime of this franchise, the grantee shall pay to the city an annual sum of five percent of the gross fees collected from users of its services for roll-off containers in the city. The franchise holder shall file quarterly reports with the city showing its receipts and pay to the city with such report the amount of franchise fee due.  
Section 9. - Acceptance of franchise. 
Within thirty (30) days from the effective date of this ordinance, grantee shall file its written acceptance of this ordinance and franchise with the city secretary, or else this ordinance shall be null and void. Upon this written acceptance by grantee, this ordinance and franchise shall constitute a contract between the city and grantee, and shall be finding upon both. Such acceptance shall reflect grantee's mailing address and grantee agrees to notify the city of any change of mailing address.  
Section 10. - Limitations of franchise. 
Nothing in this franchise agreement shall authorize grantee to furnish any trash, rubbish or garbage services to any resident of the city except by the use of temporary, roll-off containers at construction projects.  
Section 11. - Separability. 
That the City Council of the City of South Houston, Texas does hereby declare that if any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause, phrase, word or portion of this ordinance is declared invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction, the City Council would have passed and ordained any and all remaining portions of this ordinance without the inclusion of that portion or portions which may be so found to be unconstitutional or invalid and declares that its intent is to make no portion of this ordinance dependent upon the validity of any other portion thereof, and that all said remaining portions shall continue in full force and effect.  
Section 12. - Effective date. 
That this ordinance and the rules, regulations, provisions, requirements, orders and matters established and adopted hereby shall take effect and be in full force and effect from and after the date of its final passage and adoption. 
PASSED AND APPROVED by the City Council of the City of South Houston this 19 th day of November 2002. 
	/s/ Eloise Smith 
      ELOISE SMITH, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas 
 	 
Attest: 
/s/ Susan Engel 
      SUSAN ENGEL, CITY SECRETARY 
      City of South Houston, Texas

ARTICLE XII. - REPUBLIC WASTE SERVICES 
ORDINANCE NO. 2002-31 
AN ORDINANCE GRANTING A FRANCHISE TO REPUBLIC WASTE SERVICES, ITS SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS TO OPERATE A SOLID WASTE COLLECTION SERVICE IN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON USING ROLL-OFF CONTAINERS IN TEMPORARY LOCATIONS; SETTING FORTH CONDITIONS ACCOMPANYING THE GRANTING OF THIS FRANCHISE; CONTAINING A SEVERABILITY CLAUSE AND PROVIDING AN EFFECTIVE DATE. 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS: 
 
Section 1. - Short title and definitions. 
This Ordinance shall be known and may be cited as the "Republic Waste Services Franchise Ordinance". For the purposes of the Ordinance the following terms, phrases, words and their derivations shall have the meaning given herein. When not inconsistent with the context, words used in the present tense include the future, words in the plural number include the singular number, and words in the singular number include the plural number. 
(a)  City is the City of South Houston, Texas. 
(b)  Council is the City Council of South Houston, Texas. 
(c)  Solid Waste, whenever used in this Ordinance, shall mean dirt, rocks, and debris resulting from the construction, reconstruction or repair of buildings and other earthen, wooden, masonry, or metal waste materials collected in Roll Off Containers.
