(e)  Person is any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation or organization of any kind. 
(f)  Roll-off Containers shall mean steel containers positioned temporarily at a jobsite for removal of Solid Waste from the jobsite, which shall be located there only so long as the job continues.  
Section 2. - Grant of nonexclusive authority. 
(a)  There is hereby granted by the city to the company, the right and privilege to use and occupy the streets, alleys, public ways and places for the purposes herein set forth. 
(b)  The right to use and occupy said streets, alleys, public ways and places for the purposes herein set forth shall not be exclusive and the city reserves the right to grant the use of the alleys, streets, public ways and places to any person at any time during the period of this agreement.  
Section 3. - Compliance with applicable laws and regulations. 
The grantee shall, at all times during the life of this franchise, be subject to all lawful exercise of its police power by the City.  
Section 4. - Duration of franchise. 
This franchise ordinance shall remain in full force and effect for a period of five (5) years but shall be subject to renewal by the city for an additional one-year period, not to exceed a total of six (6) years, including the initial five-year period.  
Section 5. - Liability and indemnification. 
(a)  The grantee shall indemnify and hold the city harmless from any liability, cost, damage and expense of every character arising or in any manner resulting from or contributed to by any wrongful or negligent act or omission of grantee, its agents, servants or employees in the maintenance and operation of its facilities in the city or in the exercise of any right or privilege hereunder. 
(b)  The grantee shall maintain, and by its acceptance of this franchise specifically agrees, that it will maintain throughout the term of this franchise, liability insurance insuring the city and the grantee in the minimum amounts of: 
(1)  One hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) for bodily injury or death to any one person with the limit of three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000) for bodily injury or death from any one accident; 
(2)  One hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) for property damage resulting from any one accident; 
(3)  Evidence of such insurance coverage shall be submitted to the city.  
Section 6. - Forfeitures or transfer of franchise. 
(a)  If the grantee shall violate any of the terms or provisions of this franchise, and should the grantee continue to violate same for a period of thirty (30) days after grantee shall have been notified in writing by the city by notice mailed to the grantee's address furnished city by grantee to desist from such violation so specified, then the city may terminate and cancel this franchise; provided, however, that the city shall not cancel this franchise if the grantee is without fault as to the violation; and further provided, that this franchise may not be terminated and canceled until after the grantee first has been provided with adequate opportunity to be heard before the city council, and then only by ordinance duly adopted by the city council. It is further provided, however, that should the grantee be adjudged a bankrupt, then the city, after sixty (60) days' written notice to the grantee, may, if it so desires, terminate and cancel this franchise. 
(b)  The grantee shall not sell, lease, assign or transfer this franchise without the prior written approval of the city, which approval will not be unreasonably withheld; provided, however, that this franchise may be assigned by the grantee as security for debt without approval by the city.  
Section 7. - Rates. 
Rates set by the franchise holder shall be listed with the city and available for inspection by the public.  
Section 8. - Payment to the city. 
During the lifetime of this franchise, the grantee shall pay to the city an annual sum of five percent of the gross fees collected from users of its services for roll-off containers in the city. The franchise holder shall file quarterly reports with the city showing its receipts and pay to the city with such report the amount of franchise fee due.  
Section 9. - Acceptance of franchise. 
Within thirty (30) days from the effective date of this ordinance, grantee shall file its written acceptance of this ordinance and franchise with the city secretary, or else this ordinance shall be null and void. Upon this written acceptance by grantee, this ordinance and franchise shall constitute a contract between the city and grantee, and shall be finding upon both. Such acceptance shall reflect grantee's mailing address and grantee agrees to notify the city of any change of mailing address.  
Section 10. - Limitations of franchise. 
Nothing in this franchise agreement shall authorize grantee to furnish any trash, rubbish or garbage services to any resident of the city except by the use of temporary, roll-off containers at construction projects.  
Section 11. - Separability. 
That the City Council of the City of South Houston, Texas does hereby declare that if any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause, phrase, word or portion of this ordinance is declared invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction, the City Council would have passed and ordained any and all remaining portions of this ordinance without the inclusion of that portion or portions which may be so found to be unconstitutional or invalid and declares that its intent is to make no portion of this ordinance dependent upon the validity of any other portion thereof, and that all said remaining portions shall continue in full force and effect.  
Section 12. - Effective date. 
That this ordinance and the rules, regulations, provisions, requirements, orders and matters established and adopted hereby shall take effect and be in full force and effect from and after the date of its final passage and adoption. 
PASSED AND APPROVED by the City Council of the City of South Houston this 19 th day of November 2002. 
	/s/ Eloise Smith 
      ELOISE SMITH, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas 
 	 
Attest: 
/s/ Susan Engel 
      SUSAN ENGEL, 
      CITY SECRETARY 
      City of South Houston, Texas 	
 	 
 
ARTICLE XIII. - CENTERPOINT ENERGY HOUSTON ELECTRIC, LLC 
ORDINANCE NO. 2006-25 (Amendment) 
AN ORDINANCE GRANTING TO CENTERPOINT ENERGY HOUSTON ELECTRIC, LLC, THE RIGHT, PRIVILEGE AND FRANCHISE TO USE THE PUBLIC RIGHTS-OF-WAY AND TO USE, LICENSE, OR EXPLOIT THE COMPANY'S FACILITIES WITHIN THE PUBLIC RIGHTS-OF-WAY TO CONDUCT AN ELECTRIC DELIVERY BUSINESS IN THE CITY AND FOR SUCH OTHER BUSINESS PURPOSES AS THS COMPANY MAY DESIRE FROM TIME TO TIME, SPECIFICALLY INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE GRANTING OF ACCESS TO THOSE FACILITIES FOR THE DELIVERY OF BROADBAND OVER POWER LINES OR SIMILAR SERVICE WITHIN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS 
 
Section 1. - [Adopted.] 
That the facts contained in the preamble to the ordinance are determined to be true and correct and are hereby adopted.  
Section 2. - Definitions. 
Annual Adjustment Factor has the meaning set forth in Section 11 below. 
Annual Franchise Fee has the meaning set forth in Section 11 below. 
Broadband over Power Lines (BPL) or "Access BPL" has the same meaning as that used by the Federal Communications Commission in Section 15.3 of its Rules as reprinted below: 
Access Broadband over Power Line (Access BPL). A carrier current system installed and operated on an electric utility service as an unintentional radiator that sends radio frequency energy on frequencies between 1.705 Mhz and 80 Mhz over medium voltage lines or over low voltage lines to provide broadband communications and is located on the supply side of the utility service's points of interconnection with customer premises. Access BPL does not include power line carrier systems as defined in Section 15.3(t) of this part or In-House BPL as defined in Section 15.3(gg) of this part. 
City means the City of SOUTH HOUSTON, Texas, a municipal corporation of the State of Texas. 
City Council means the governing body of the City, or its designee. 
Company means CenterPoint Energy Houston Electric, LLC, a Texas limited liability company. 
Effective Date means July 1, 2006. 
First Rate Case has the meaning set forth in Section 14 below. 
Force Majeure means forces or conditions not reasonably within the control of a party, including a strike; war or act of war (whether an actual declaration of war is made or not); insurrection; riot; act of public enemy; fire; flood or OTHER act of God; sabotage; shortages in materials, supplies and equipment; governmental regulations, limitations and restrictions as to the use and availability of materials, supplies and equipment and as to the use of services; unforeseen and unusual demands for service; or other events, where the affected party has exercised all due care in the prevention thereof and such causes or OTHER events are without the fault or negligence of the affected party. 
Franchise means this Ordinance and the rights and privileges granted by this Ordinance. 
Franchise Year has the meaning set forth in Section 11, below. 
Franchise Area means the area within the boundaries of the City as of the Effective Date and as same may change from time to time during the term of the Franchise. 
Initial Franchise Year shall have the meaning set forth in Section 11, below. 
Other Services means any service, exclusive of the transmission and distribution of electricity, provided or allowed to be provided through the use or license of the System for a fee, including but not limited to BPL. 
Person means any individual, firm, partnership, association, corporation, company or organization of any kind. 
Prior Franchise has the meaning set forth in the first Whereas clause, above. 
Public Rights-of-Way means the areas in, under, upon, over, across, and along any and all of the present and future streets or streams now or hereafter owned or controlled by the City. 
Public Works Improvement Projects has the meaning set forth in Section 5, below. 
PUC means the Public Utility Commission of Texas, or its successor agency with equivalent jurisdiction. 
Retail Customer means any Person taking delivery of electricity from the Company, at a point of delivery within the Franchise Area. 
Street means the surface and the space above and below any public street, road, highway, alley, bridge, sidewalk, or other public place or way. 
System means the Company's facilities erected, constructed, maintained, operated, used, extended, removed, replaced, and repaired, as necessary, by the Company pursuant to this Franchise, including without limitation, all poles, pole lines, towers, transmission lines, wires, guys, conduits, cables, and OTHER desirable instrumentalities and appurtenances (including telegraph and telephone poles and wires for use of the Company), necessary and proper for the purpose of transmitting and distributing electricity to the City and the inhabitants of said City or OTHER Persons, for any purpose for which electricity may be used. 
(Ord. No. 2006-32, § 2, 11-7-06)  
Section 3. - [Grant of franchise.] 
Subject to the terms, conditions and provisions of this franchise, the city hereby grants to the company the right, privilege and franchise to use the city's public rights-of-way to construct, maintain, operate and use the company's system to conduct within the city an electric delivery business and the right to use, license, or exploit the system within the public rights-of-way for other services. this franchise does not restrict the city's right to impose reasonable fees upon third parties for the use of the public rights-of-way to provide other services, so long as such fees are assessed on a non-discriminatory basis with those charged to other companies providing services competitive with the other services.  
Section 4. - [Term.] 
Upon the filing with the City by the Company of the acceptance required hereunder, the Prior Franchise shall be amended by replacing the language thereof, in its entirety, with the language of this Franchise; and the term thereof shall be extended; and it shall remain in full force and effect for an additional term and period of thirty (30) years from and after January 1, 2008.  
Section 5. - [Rights-of-way.] 
All poles erected by the Company pursuant to the authority herein granted shall be of sound material and reasonably straight, and shall be so set that they shall not interfere with the flow of water in any gutter or drain, and so that the same shall interfere as little as practicable with the ordinary travel, on the Streets or other Public Rights-of-Way. Within the Streets or other Public Rights-of-Way of the City, the location and route of all poles, stubs, guys, anchors, lines, conduits and cables placed and constructed and to be placed and constructed by the Company in the construction and maintenance of the Company's System in the City, shall be subject to the reasonable and proper regulation, control and direction of the City, or of any City official to whom such duties have or may be duly delegated, which regulation and control shall include, but not by way of limitation, the right to require in writing, to the extent provided in Section 10, the relocation of the Company's System at the Company's cost within the Streets or other Public Rights-of-Way whenever such shall be reasonably necessary to accommodate improvement projects within such Streets or Public Rights-of-Way by the city department with primary responsibility for public works' projects ("Public Works Improvement Projects").  
Section 6. - [Surrenders possession of public right-of-way.] 
In consideration for the compensation set forth in Sections 11 and 15, the City agrees that if the City sells, conveys, or surrenders possession of any portion of the Public Right-of-Way that is being used by the Company pursuant to this Franchise, the City, to the maximum extent of its right to do so, shall first grant the Company an easement for such use; and the sale, conveyance, or surrender of possession of the Public Right-of-Way shall be subject to the right and continued use of the Company.  
Section 7. - [Time periods and standards.] 
Following completion of work in Public Rights-of-Way, the Company shall repair the affected Public Rights-of-Way as soon as possible, but in all cases shall comply with all valid City ordinances governing time periods and standards relating to excavating in the Public Rights-of-Way. No Street or other Public Right-of-Way shall be encumbered by construction, maintenance or removal work by the Company for a longer period than shall be necessary to execute such work.  
Section 8. - [Grade of service.] 
The service furnished hereunder to the City and its inhabitants shall be first-class in all respects, considering all circumstances, and the Company shall furnish the grade of service to Retail Customers as provided by its rate schedules and shall maintain its System in reasonable operating condition during the continuance of this Franchise. The Company's tariffs shall govern the rates, access to service, terms and quality of electric delivery services provided by the Company. An exception to the requirement is automatically in effect when due to Force Majeure. In any Force Majeure event, the Company shall do all things reasonably within its power to restore normal service.  
Section 9. - [Temporary removal of wires.] 
The Company, on the written request of any person, shall remove or raise or lower its wires temporarily to permit construction work in the vicinity thereof or to permit the moving of vessels, houses or other bulky structures. The expense of such temporary removal, raising or lowering of wires, shall be paid by the benefited party or parties, and the Company may require such payment in advance, being without obligation to remove, raise, or lower its wires until such payment has been made. The Company shall be given adequate, and in no event fewer than forty-eight (48) hours, advance notice to arrange for such temporary wire changes.  
Section 10. - [Transmission and distribution facilities.] 
The Company shall construct, operate, and maintain its transmission and distribution facilities in substantial accordance with the Company's own Service Standards and the National Electrical Safety Code ("NESC"). The Company shall determine the specific location and the method of construction and types of materials used in building, maintaining, and operating the Company's transmission and distribution facilities. The City shall require its employees and contractors performing work for the benefit of the city to comply with all applicable laws, statutes, codes and standards (including, without limitation, Section 752 of the Texas Health and Safety Code, as the same may be amended or replaced, and the NESC) when working near the Company's System and to report as soon as practicable any damage done to the Company's System. The Company also agrees to require its employees and contractors performing work for the benefit of the City to comply with all applicable laws, statutes, codes and standards (including, without limitation, Section 752 of the Texas Health and Safety Code, as the same may be amended or replaced, and the NESC) when working near the City's facilities and to report as soon as practicable any damage done to the City's facilities. The Company shall relocate facilities within Public Rights-of-Way at the Company's own expense, exclusive of street lighting and facilities installed for service directly to the City, to accommodate Public Works Improvement Projects, including, but not limited to, street widening, change of grade, water, sewer, or drainage upgrades, construction or reconstruction projects and minor relocation of traffic lanes. The City shall bear the costs of all relocations of street lighting and facilities installed for service directly to the City and of any relocation of other facilities requested by the City for reasons other than Public Works Improvement Projects. Except in the event of an emergency, the City shall give the Company at least seventy-two (72) hours' notice when the City or City's contractor is requesting the bracing of the Company's poles. The Company shall pay for the bracing to accommodate Public Works Improvement Projects, including, but not limited to, street widening, change of grade, water, sewer, or drainage upgrades, construction or reconstruction projects and minor relocation of traffic lanes.  
Section 11. - [Annual franchise fee.] 
In consideration for the rights and privileges herein granted, the Company agrees to pay to the City, beginning on the Effective Date and continuing throughout the remaining term of the Prior Franchise and the additional thirty (30) year term of this Franchise provided for in Section 4, above, an annual franchise fee (referred to herein as "Annual Franchise Fee"), subject to an Annual Adjustment Factor as set forth below. Except as set forth in Section 15, payment of the Annual Franchise Fee shall be the total compensation payable to the City in consideration for the right, privilege and franchise herein conferred for the Company's use of the Public Rights-of-Way to construct, operate, use and maintain its System for the provision of electric transmission and distribution service and its right to use, license, or exploit its System for Other Services. 
The Annual Franchise Fee shall be calculated as follows: 
1.  The "Annual Franchise Fee," for the twelve-month period beginning on the Effective Date (the "Initial Franchise Year"), shall be $440,774.36. 
2.  The Annual Franchise Fee for each succeeding twelve-month period (each a "Franchise Year"), including the Franchise Year beginning July 1, 2007, shall be adjusted by multiplying $440,774.36 by the Annual Adjustment Factor. The "Annual Adjustment Factor" for any given year shall be a fraction, the numerator of which shall be the kWh delivered by the Company within the Franchise Area (inclusive of street lighting) in the previous calendar year and the denominator of which shall be the kWh delivered by the Company within the Franchise Area (inclusive of street lighting) in 2005, said amount being 135,063,649 kWh. (Example: The Annual Franchise Fee for the Franchise Year beginning July 1, 2010 $440,774.36)x 2009 kWh 135,063,649 kWh). 
In no case, however, shall the Annual Franchise Fee be less than the Annual Franchise Fee established in (1), above, for the Initial Franchise Year. 
In calculating the amount to be paid each year, the Company shall offset its Annual Franchise Fee payments with the amount of the Municipal Account Franchise Credits and Municipal Franchise Fee Credits provided in the Company's tariffs and applicable to the City in the prior calendar year. The annual Franchise fee shall be payable in equal monthly installments due the first day of each calendar month. The Company shall calculate the new franchise fee to be payable for each Franchise Year beginning July 1 st and shall provide the same along with the basis for such calculation to the City for its review no later than April 1 st of each year. If the Company does not receive an objection from the City by May 31 st , the Company shall implement the adjusted Annual Franchise Fee payment on July 1 st . If the additional thirty (30) year term of this Franchise provided for in Section 4, above, ends on any day other than the last day of the last Franchise Year, then the Annual Franchise Fee for the final Franchise Year shall first be calculated pursuant to this Section 11 and then pro-rated accordingly.  
Section 12. - [Franchise payments.] 
The parties agree that the franchise payments due under this Franchise are reasonable and necessary and that the parties shall use their best efforts to enable the Company to recover these payments through its electric rates.  
Section 13. - [No additional charges.] 
Except as provided in Section 15, the Annual Franchise Fee payable hereunder shall be the total compensation payable by the Company to the City for the Company's use of the Public Rights-of-Way for the conduct of its business under the Franchise. The City shall not charge any additional license, charge, fee, street or alley rental, or OTHER character of charge or levy for the use or occupancy of the Public Rights-of-Way in the City, or any pole tax or inspection fee tax. If the City does charge the Company any additional license, charge, fee, street or alley rental, or other character of charge or levy, then the Company may deduct the amount charged from the next succeeding franchise payment or payments until fully reimbursed. The Franchise shall constitute a permit to perform all work on the Company's System within the Public Rights-of-Way and to park vehicles in the Streets and other Public Rights-of-Way when necessary for the installation, removal, operation or maintenance of the Company's System. The Company and contractors performing work for the Company shall not be required to obtain any permits in addition to the Franchise or to pay any fee in addition to the Annual Franchise Fee in order to perform work on the Company's System or to park within the Streets and other Public Rights-of-Way. The Company shall cooperate with the City to avoid unnecessary disruption, and the Company shall comply with all valid City ordinances governing time periods and standards relating to excavating in the Public Rights-of-Way.  
Section 14. - [Base rates.] 
In the first rate case to review the Company's base rates following the Effective Date (the "First Rate Case"), the City shall support the Company's request to include in the Company's base rates the entire then-effective Annual Franchise Fee. If, as a result of the First Rate Case, or any subsequent rate case, the Company's entire then-effective Annual Franchise Fee is not included in the Company's base rates, then the Company shall be required to pay only so much in franchise fees as the amount of franchise fees used by the PUC to calculate the Company's then-effective rates.  
Section 15. - [Conductor space.] 
In addition to the considerations set forth in Section 11, the Company shall furnish, free of charge, subject to the use of the City, such pole and/or duct space as may be required from time to time for the installation of the City-owned traffic, police and fire alarm system conductors; provided such conductor space does not exceed the available capacity on any one existing pole or in one existing interior duct. The Company shall allow for the expanded use of existing energized conductors by the City for the purposes of providing traffic signal communication interconnectivity with prior written approval from the Company. The specific location for these traffic, police and fire alarm conductors on the Company poles or ducts shall be determined by the Company and shall be allotted at the time specific applications for space are received from the City. All City traffic, police and fire alarm circuits on the Company poles and ducts shall be designed and installed, operated and maintained in compliance with the applicable provisions of the NESC and other laws, statutes, codes and ordinances applicable to private parties and so as to create no interference, corrosion, harm, damage or hazard with, to or from the Company's System or the Company's business. All plans for such city traffic, police and fire alarm circuits must be submitted for the Company's written approval prior to installation. Any modifications to the Company's System necessary to accommodate such installation shall be paid by the City. If, after installation, the City's equipment is found to interfere with the Company's System or business, the Company and the City shall work together to address the problem and, if deemed practical by the Company, preserve the City's access. Where main underground duct lines are located between manholes, the Company shall permit free of charge the installation in one interior duct by the City of its traffic, police or fire alarm signal cables; provided space is available in an interior duct not suitable for power circuits without interference with the Company's system neutral conductors. All cables installed by the City in the Company ducts shall be of the non-metallic sheath type to prevent corrosive or electrolytic action between the City- and the Company-owned cables. A request for duct assignment shall in each instance be submitted to the Company and a sketch showing duct allocation shall be received from the Company prior to the installation of the City cables in Company-owned duct lines. All City-owned conductors and cables, whether on poles or in duct lines, shall be constructed, maintained and operated in such manner as to not interfere with or create a hazard in the operation of the Company's System or the Company's business. If, after installation, the City's equipment is found to interfere with the Company's System or business, the Company and the City shall work together to address the problem and, if deemed practical by the Company, preserve the City's access. 
In addition to the consideration set forth in Section 11, the Company shall permit the City to use, free of charge, extra space on its street light poles to install City-owned traffic control signs and decorative banners, with prior written approval from the Company and provided that such use is consistent with the NESC and OTHER applicable engineering and operational codes and standards. 
Notwithstanding any other provision in this Franchise, it is further agreed that the Company shall not be responsible to any party or parties whatsoever for any claims, demands, losses, suits, judgments for damages or injuries to Persons or property by reason of the construction, maintenance, inspection or use of the traffic signal light systems, police and fire alarm systems, traffic control signs, or decorative banners belonging to the City and constructed upon the Company's poles or street light poles or in its ducts, and the City shall indemnify and hold the Company harmless against all such claims, losses, demands, suits and judgments, to the extent permitted by the Texas Tort Claims Act, but the City does not, by this agreement, admit primary liability to any third party by reason of the City's operation and use of such traffic signal light systems, police and fire alarm systems, traffic control signs, or decorative banners, such being a function of government.  
Section 16. - [Audit.] 
The City may conduct an audit or other inquiry, or may pursue a cause of action in relation to the payment of the Annual Franchise Fee only if such audit, inquiry, or pursuit of a cause of action concerns a payment made fewer than two (2) years before commencement of such audit, inquiry, or pursuit of a cause of action. The City shall bear the costs of any such audit or inquiry. All books and records related to the Company's operations under this Franchise shall be available to the City. Upon receipt of a written request from the City, such documents shall be made available for inspection and copying no later than thirty (30) days from the receipt of such request. Amounts due to the City for past underpayments or amounts due the Company for past overpayments shall include interest calculated using the annual interest rates for overcharges as set by the Texas Public Utility Commission. Said interest shall be payable on such sum from the date the initial payment was due until it is past.  
Section 17. - [Waive claims of prior franchise agreements.] 
The parties agree to waive any and all claims, asserted or unasserted, arising out of prior franchise agreements including, without limitation, the Prior Franchise, except those claims relating to the Company's obligations as determined in an audit underway as of March 1, 2006.  
Section 18. - [Exclusive rights of privileges.] 
Nothing contained in this Franchise shall ever be construed as conferring upon the Company any exclusive rights or privileges of any nature whatsoever.  
Section 19. - [Efficient electrical service.] 
It shall be Company's obligation as provided in Section 8 hereof to furnish efficient electrical service to the public at reasonable rates and to maintain its property in good repair and working order except when prevented from so doing by forces and conditions not reasonably within the control of the Company. Should the Company fail or refuse to maintain its System in good order and furnish efficient service at all times throughout the life of this grant, except only when prevented from so doing by Force Majeure, or should Company fail or refuse to furnish efficient service at reasonable rates, lawfully determined by the City, throughout the life of this grant, excepting only during such periods as the Company shall in good faith diligently contest the reasonableness of the rates in question, then it shall forfeit and pay to the City the sum of Twenty-Five Dollars ($25) for each day it shall so fail or refuse after reasonable notice thereof and a hearing thereon by the City. Any suit to recover such penalty shall be filed within one year from the date the penalty accrues.  
Section 20. - [Invalid, illegal or incapable provisions.] 
If any term or other provision of the Franchise is determined by an unappealable decision by a court, administrative agency, or arbitrator to be invalid, illegal, or incapable of being enforced by any rule of law or public policy, all other conditions and provisions of the Franchise shall nevertheless remain in full force and effect so long as the economic or legal substance is not affected in any manner materially adverse to either party. Upon such determination that any term or other provision is invalid, illegal, or incapable of being enforced, the parties shall negotiate in good faith to modify the Franchise so as to effect the original intent of the parties as closely as possible.  
Section 21. - [Claims for damages.] 
Subject to Section 15, the Company, its successors and assigns, shall protect and hold the City harmless against all claims for damages or demands for damages to any Person or property by reason of the construction and maintenance of its electricity transmission and distribution System, or in any way growing out of the granting of this Franchise, either directly or indirectly, or by reason of any act, negligence, or nonfeasance of the contractors, agents or employees of the Company, its successors or assigns, and shall refund to the City all sums which it may be adjudged to pay on any such claim, or which may arise or grow out of the exercise of the rights and privileges hereby granted, or by the abuse thereof, and the Company, its successors and assigns, shall indemnify and hold the City harmless from and on account of all damages, costs, expenses, actions, and causes of action, to the extent permitted by the Texas Tort Claims Act, that may accrue to or be brought by any Person, Persons, Company or Companies at any time hereafter by reason of the exercise of the rights and privileges hereby granted, or of the abuse thereof.  
Section 22. - [City regulation.] 
In granting this Franchise, it is understood that the lawful power vested by law in the City to regulate all public utilities within the City, and to regulate the local rates of public utilities within the City, within the limits of the Constitution and laws, and to require all persons or corporations to discharge the duties and undertakings, for the performance of which this Franchise was made, is reserved; and this grant is made subject to all lawful rights, powers and authorities, either of regulation or otherwise, reserved to the City by its Charter or by the general laws of this State.  
Section 23. - [Amendment.] 
This Franchise amends the Prior Franchise, and extends the term of the Prior Franchise for an additional thirty (30) years and replaces all other former franchise agreements with the Company, or its predecessors, which are hereby repealed.  
Section 24. - [Lose, waive, impair powers and rights in the city.] 
The City, by the granting of this Franchise, does not surrender or to any extent lose, waive, impair or lessen the lawful powers and rights, now or hereafter vested in the City under the Constitution and statutes of the State of Texas and under the Charter of the City to regulate the rates and services of the Company; and the Company, by its acceptance of this Franchise, agrees that all such lawful regulatory powers and rights as the same may be from time to time vested in the City shall be in full force and effect and subject to the exercise thereof by the City at any time and from time to time.  
Section 25. - [File.] 
Within 30 days following the final passage and approval of this ordinance, the Company shall file with the City Secretary, accompanied by appropriate authorized corporate resolutions in a form acceptable to the City Attorney, a written statement in the following form signed in its name and behalf: 
"To the Honorable Mayor and the City Council of the City of SOUTH HOUSTON, Texas: 
For itself, its successors and assigns, Grantee, CENTERPOINT ENERGY HOUSTON ELECTRIC, LLC, hereby accepts the attached ordinance and agrees to be bound by all of its terms, conditions and provisions." 
CENTERPOINT ENERGY HOUSTON ELECTRIC, LLC 
By: _____ 
Name: _____ 
Title: _____ 
"Dated this the _______ day of ________ 2006."  
Section 26. - [Published.] 
This Franchise having been published as required by the Texas Local Government Code shall take effect and be in force immediately following its final passage and approval, and receipt by the City of the Company's acceptance filed pursuant to Section 25, in compliance with the provisions of the Texas Local Government Code. The Company shall pay the cost of those publications and any costs associated with any elections held regarding this Franchise required by such provisions.  
Section 27. - [Notice, order, etc. sent by registered or certified mail.] 
Every notice, order, petition, document, or other direction or communication to be served upon the City or the Company shall be deemed sufficiently given if sent by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested. Every such communication to the Company shall be sent to: 
Vice President, Regulatory Relations 
CenterPoint Energy, Inc. 
1111 Louisiana Street 
Houston, Texas 77002 
Unless and until changed by written notice given in accordance with this section, every such communication to the City or the City Council shall be sent to: 
Maria Vega, City Secretary 
City of South Houston 
P. O. Box 238 
1018 Dallas Street 
South Houston, Texas 77587 
and, as applicable, to: 
Joe Soto, Mayor 
City of South Houston 
P. O. Box 238 
1018 Dallas Street 
South Houston, Texas 77587 
The mailing of such notice, direction, or order shall be equivalent to direct personal notice and shall be deemed to have been given the earlier of receipt or two business days after it was mailed.  
Section 28. - [Right and remedies are cumulative.] 
The rights and remedies provided herein are cumulative and not exclusive of any remedies provided by law, and nothing contained in this Franchise shall impair any of the rights of the City or the Company under applicable law, subject in each case to the terms and conditions of this Franchise. 
PASSED AND APPROVED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, ON THE 2 nd DAY OF AUGUST 2006. 
	      JOE SOTO, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas 
 	 
ATTEST: 
      MARIA VEGA, CITY SECRETARY 
      City of South Houston, Texas 	
 	 
 
ARTICLE XIV. - REPUBLIC WASTE SERVICES, INC. 
Ordinance No. 2008-07 
AN ORDINANCE GRANTING A FRANCHISE TO REPUBLIC WASTE SERVICES, INC., ITS SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS TO OPERATE A SOLID WASTE COLLECTION SERVICE IN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON; SETTING FORTH CONDITIONS ACCOMPANYING THE GRANTING OF THIS FRANCHISE; CONTAINING A SEVERABILITY CLAUSE AND PROVIDING AN EFFECTIVE DATE 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS: 
 
Section 1. - Definitions. 
For the purpose of this Ordinance, the following terms, phrases, words and their derivatives shall have the meaning given herein. when not inconsistent with the context, words used in the present tense include the future, words in the plural number include the singular number, and words in the singular number include the plural number. 
(a)  City is the City of South Houston, Texas. 
(b)  Council is the City Council of South Houston, Texas. 
(c)  Solid Waste whenever used in this Ordinance, shall have the definition as set forth in Chapter 10 of the Code of Ordinances of the City of South Houston, as amended. 
(d)  Grantee is Republic Waste Services, Inc. 
(e)  Person is any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation or organization of any kind.  
Section 2. - Grant of exclusive authority. 
(a)  There is hereby granted by the City to the Grantee, the exclusive right and privilege to collect and dispose of Solid Waste (refuse) for the City of South Houston, except for temporary use of roll-off containers, all as set out in that one certain contract between Grantee and City as passed and approved by the City Council on June 24, 2008, and to use and occupy the streets, alleys and public ways for the purposes set forth therein.  
Section 3. - Compliance with applicable laws and regulations. 
The Grantee shall, at all times during the life of this franchise, be subject to all lawful exercise of its police power by the City.  
Section 4. - Duration of franchise. 
This franchise ordinance shall remain in full force and effect for a period of five years, commencing on July 1, 2008; and shall automatically renew for an additional three-year (3) period unless notice is given by either the Service Provider or the City to the other within sixty days prior to the end of the initial five-year (5) period.  
Section 5. - Liability and indemnification. 
(a)  The Grantee shall indemnify and hold the City harmless from any liability, cost, damage and expense of every character arising out of, or in any manner resulting from or contributed to by, any wrongful or negligent act or omission of Grantee, its agents, servants or employees in the maintenance and operation of its facilities in the City or in the exercise of any right or privilege hereunder. 
(b)  The Grantee shall maintain, and by its acceptance of this franchise specifically agrees that it will maintain throughout the term of this franchise, liability insurance insuring the City, as provided in the aforesaid contract. Evidence of such insurance coverage shall be submitted to the City.  
Section 6. - Forfeitures or transfer of franchise. 
(a)  If the Grantee shall violate any of the terms or provisions of this franchise and should the Grantee continue to violate same for a period of thirty (30) days after Grantee shall have been notified in writing by the City by notice mailed to the Grantee(s address furnished the City by Grantee, to desist from such violation so specified, then the City may terminate and cancel this franchise; provided, however, that the City shall not cancel this franchise if the Grantee is without fault as to the violation; and further provided that this franchise may not be terminated and canceled until after the Grantee first has been provided with adequate opportunity to be heard before the City Council, and then only by ordinance duly adopted by the City Council. It is further provided, however, that should the Grantee be adjudged a bankrupt, then the City, after sixty (60) days written notice to the Grantee, may, if it so desires, terminate and cancel this franchise. 
(b)  The Grantee shall not sell, lease, assign or transfer this franchise without the prior written approval of the City, which approval will not be unreasonably withheld; provided, however, that this franchise may be assigned by the Grantee as security for debt without approval by the City.  
Section 7. - Rates. 
Rates set by the franchise holder shall be listed with the City and available for inspection by the public.  
Section 8. - Payment to the city. 
During the lifetime of this franchise, the Grantee shall pay to the City an annual sum of five percent of the gross fees collected from users of its services in the City. The franchise holder shall file quarterly reports with the City showing its receipts and pay to the City with such report the amount of franchise fee due.  
Section 9. - Acceptance of franchise. 
Within thirty (30) days from the effective date of this ordinance, Grantee shall file its written acceptance of this ordinance and franchise with the City Secretary, or else this ordinance shall be null and void. Upon this written acceptance by Grantee, this ordinance and franchise shall constitute a contract between the City and Grantee and shall be binding upon both. Such acceptance shall reflect Grantee(s mailing address and Grantee agrees to notify the City of any change of mailing address.  
Section 10. - Severability. 
That the City Council of the City of South Houston, Texas, does hereby declare that if any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause, phrase, word or portion of this ordinance is declared invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction, the City Council would have passed and ordained any and all remaining portions of this ordinance without the inclusion of that portion or portions which may be so found to be unconstitutional or invalid and declares that its intent is to make no portion of this ordinance dependent upon the validity of any other portion thereof, and that all said remaining portions shall continue in full force and effect.  
Section 11. - Effective date. 
That this ordinance and the rules, regulations, provisions, requirements, orders and matters established and adopted hereby shall take effect and be in full force and effect from and after the date of its final passage and adoption. 
PASSED AT A SPECIAL MEETING OF THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, HELD ON THE 24TH DAY OF JUNE 2008. 
	      JOE SOTO, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas 
 	 
ATTEST: 
      MARICELA BARRERA, CITY SECRETARY 
      City of South Houston, Texas 	
 	 
 
ARTICLE XV. - CLOVER PRODUCTION COMPANY AND GAS COMPANY 
ORDINANCE NO. 2012-10 
COUNCIL CONSIDERATION AND APPROVAL OF AN ORDINANCE OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, PROVIDING FOR CONSENT TO THE CHANGE OF A FRANCHISE IN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, ORIGINALLY GRANTED TO M & R EXPLORATION COMPANY FOR AN OIL AND GAS PIPELINE, UNDER ORDINANCE NO. 995, DATED MARCH 1, 1994,; PROVIDING THAT TERRY OIL AND GAS COMPANY, D/B/A CLOVER PRODUCTION COMPANY, HAS ACQUIRED 100% OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN THE SYSTEM AND FRANCHISE; PROVIDING THAT THE NEW OWNERSHIP AND FRANCHISEE SHALL BE CALLED CLOVER PRODUCTION COMPANY; INCREASING THE FRANCHISE FEE AND CHARGES ASSESSED FOR VARIOUS PURPOSES AND THEREFORE DIRECTING THE BUILDING OFFICIAL TO ISSUE A PERMIT UNDER ORDINANCE NO. 2012-08, PASSED IN JUNE 2012; BUT WAIVING THE PERMIT FEE THEREUNDER SINCE NEW FEES ARE CHARGED IN THIS FRANCHISE; PROHIBITING ASSIGNMENT WITHOUT WRITTEN CITY APPROVAL; REQUIRING THE FRANCHISEE TO SIGN THIS FRANCHISE AGREEING TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS AND THE ORIGINAL TERMS OF ORDINANCE NO. 995; AND PROVIDING FOR AN EFFECTIVE DATE 
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS: 
 
Section 1. - . 
The forgoing recitals are approved and incorporated herein by reference.  
Section 2. - . 
The Franchise Authority consents to the Transaction described herein.  
Section 3. - . 
This ordinance shall be deemed effective upon final adoption as soon as the franchisee acknowledges its acceptance of the obligation to be bound by the original ordinance as amended and pays its fees for the franchise.  
Section 4. - . 
This ordinance shall have the force of a continuing agreement and the Franchise Authority shall not amend or otherwise alter this Ordinance without the written consent of the city.  
Section 5. - . 
Section 5 of the original ordinance styled FRANCHISE FEES is hereby amended to read: The grantee (franchisee) shall pay to the city an initial franchise fee upon this transfer of $1,500 and shall thereafter pay an annual fee to the city of $1,000 on the anniversary date of this approval of the transfer. That annual fee of $1,000 may be increased or decreased by resolution of the City Council without the necessity of the passage of another amendment of this ordinance, but any new assignment or sale must be with written city approval. The payment of this initial fee of $1,500, and the payment of any delinquent fees for this franchise to date, whether incurred by this applicant or its predecessor, shall entitle applicant to a permit under Ordinance No. 2012-08, passed in June 2012, without paying any fees called for therein and the payment of the annual fee called for herein shall also exempt franchisee from paying the annual fee in Ordinance No. 2012-08 so long as this franchise is still in effect, but not otherwise. 
PASSED AND APPROVED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, ON THE 26 th DAY OF JUNE 2012. 
	      JOE SOTO, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas 
 	 
ATTEST: 
      BARBARA S. BIGHAM, CITY SECRETARY 
      City of South Houston, Texas 	
 	 
 
ARTICLE XVI. - FAIRWAY ENERGY PARTNERS, LLC 
ORDINANCE NO. 2016-03 
AN ORDINANCE GRANTING FAIRWAY ENERGY PARTNERS, LLC, THE RIGHT, PRIVILEGE AND FRANCHISE TO CONSTRUCT, INSTALL, AND ERECT A 24" PIPELINE (PIPELINE NUMBER ONE OF TWO) TO FACILITATE THE TRANSPORTATION OF CRUDE OIL AND CONDENSATE WITHIN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS TO BE FILED WITH THE CITY SECRETARY; PROVIDING FOR AN ANNUAL FEE; PRESCRIBING THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS UNDER WHICH SAID RIGHT, PRIVILEGE AND FRANCHISE IS GRANTED; AND PROVIDING FOR THE ACCEPTANCE THEREOF 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, THAT: 
 
Section 1. - Franchise. 
The City Council (hereinafter called "CITY") hereby grants to FAIRWAY ENERGY PARTNERS, LLC, the right, privilege and franchise to construct, install, erect, reuse, replace, maintain, operate and remove a 24" pipeline (pipeline number 1 of 2) in a location depicted on the attached Vicinity Map CB-4071-161 within the City of South Houston, Texas, to facilitate the transportation of crude oil and condensate in accordance with the plans and specifications to be filed with the City Secretary. The 24" pipeline shall be designed by the applicant's engineer and then finally submitted to the City's consulting engineer for his review and approval. The applicant's contractor shall have to perform excavation and construction to determine the reuse of same. Without the approval of the City's consulting engineer, the applicant may do no work on the 24" pipeline or the project. The applicant's final engineering/surveying plans and specifications (containing the City's consulting engineer's written approval) shall be filed with the City Secretary. The applicant shall furnish reproducible copies of the final approved drawings. THIS IS ONLY A FRANCHISE FOR THE UNDERGROUND FACILITY AND NOT FOR ANY PIPELINE EQUIPMENT OR APPARATUS ABOVE GROUND SAVE AND EXCEPT WARNING SIGNS WHICH SHALL BE ABOVE GROUND.  
Section 2. - General Information. 
APPLICANT: Fairway Energy Partners, LLC 
Three Riverway, Ste. 1550, Houston, TX 77056 
APPLICANT'S ENGINEER: Steve Lalumandier 
APPLICANT'S CONTRACTOR: Duphil, Inc. 
6608 Interstate 10 
Orange, TX 77632 
APPLICANT'S person in charge: 
Name: William E. Rome 
Title: Chief Operating Officer 
E mail: BillRome@fairwaymidstream.com 
Office Phone: 713-559-1962 Cell: 281-415-3819 
Fax: 713-840-1447 
Applicant shall keep current the above information and shall promptly notify the City Secretary in writing of any changes. Failure to comply with same shall carry a penalty of $500.00 per occurrence.  
Section 3. - Franchise Fees. 
The Franchisee applicant shall pay to the City of South Houston a franchise fee in the amount of $2,000.00, an administration fee for data and inspection of $1,500.00, and shall thereafter pay an annual fee of $1,000.00 on or before the anniversary date of the final passage of this Ordinance.  
Section 4. - Laws, Regulations, Rules and Permits. 
The franchisee applicant and all work done under the grant of authority contained herein shall be governed by all present and future laws, rules or regulations of this City, the State of Texas, or the United States of America. The franchisee applicant shall obtain and keep current at its expense all permits and licenses required by law for so long as they are required. This franchise is not transferrable without the written consent of the City.  
Section 5. - Indemnification. 
In each application for a permit, each person, firm or corporation to whom a permit is issued shall indemnify and hold the CITY harmless from any liability, cost, damage, attorney fees or costs of any kind resulting from the construction, installation, replacement, maintenance, operation and removal of the 24" pipeline by the franchisee applicant, its LICENSED OPERATORS, agents, independent contractors or representatives.  
Section 6. - Plans and Inspections. 
All work and design shall be done in a good and workmanlike manner in accordance with the Plans and Specs on file with the City. City's consulting engineer or his designated inspector or the City building official shall personally inspect the work. Prior notice of the construction activity shall be given to the City before any construction efforts are closed-in or filled. No excavated areas shall be un-barricaded overnight. Any construction changes shall require the approval of the City consulting engineer. City inspection expenses shall be reimbursed by applicant franchisee. The precise location of the 24" pipeline shall be suggested by the applicant franchisee and approved by a City inspector prior to commencement of excavation or digging. The area shall be left and kept at all times clean, neat and presentable and free of rubbish and hazards such as holes or sharp objects.  
Section 7. - Acceptance. 
Applicant franchisee shall file its written acceptance of this Franchise with the City Secretary within thirty (30) days of final passage and shall thereupon be bound by the terms and conditions. 
PASSED AND APPROVED THIS 23 rd DAY OF FEBRUARY, 2016. 
	      JOE SOTO, MAYOR 
      CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS 
 	 
ATTEST: 
      LANCE AVANT, CITY SECRETARY 
      CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS

ARTICLE XVIII. - REPUBLIC WASTE SERVICES, INC. 
ORDINANCE NO. 2016-14 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING ORDINANCE NO. 2008-07, GRANTING A FRANCHISE TO REPUBLIC WASTE SERVICES, INC., ITS SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS, TO OPERATE A SOLID WASTE COLLECTION SERVICE IN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON; TO RENEW THE FRANCHISE AGREEMENT FROM JULY 1, 2016, THROUGH JUNE 30, 2019; SETTING FORTH CONDITIONS ACCOMPANYING THE GRANTING OF THIS FRANCHISE; CONTAINING A SEVERABILITY CLAUSE AND PROVIDING AN EFFECTIVE DATE 
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS: 
 
Section 1. 
This Amendment to the City of South Houston, Texas, Franchise Agreement for the Collection, Hauling and Disposal of Municipal Solid Waste in the City of South Houston, Texas, (the "Amendment') is made effective as of July 1, 2016, by and between the City of South Houston, Texas (the "City"), and BFI Waste Services of Texas, LP d/b/a Allied Waste Services, Houston Services Group // Republic Services of Houston, qualified to do and actually doing business in the state of Texas (herein called the "Contractor"). The City and the Contractor are referred to in this Agreement collectively as the "Parties" and individually as "Party."  
Section 2. - Recitals. 
A.  The Parties entered into that certain Franchise Agreement for the Collection, Hauling and Disposal of Municipal Solid Waste in the City of South Houston, Texas, dated July 1, 2008 (the "Agreement") pursuant to which Contractor agreed to provide solid waste collection and disposal services as set forth in this Agreement; and 
B.  The Parties desire to amend the Agreement pursuant to the terms of this Amendment.  
Section 3. - Amendment. 
Now, therefore, for and in consideration of the respective covenants herein contained, the Parties have agreed as follows: 
• Extension of Term. The term of the Agreement shall be extended for an additional period of three (3) years, and such new term will begin July 1, 2016, and continue through June 30, 2019. 
• Modification of Rates. 
a.  Rates for commercial and industrial services shall be increased by five percent (5%) during each year of the extension of term beginning on January 1, 2017, and continuing through January 1, 2019. 
b.  Rates for residential services shall be increased by three percent (3%) during each year of the extension of term beginning on January 1, 2017, and continuing through January 1, 2019. 
• Recitals. The Recitals set forth above are true and accurate, and are hereby incorporated into this Amendment by this reference. 
• References to Contractor. The Parties agree that all references to "Contractor" in the Agreement, as amended, shall mean BFI Waste Services of Texas, LP. 
• Conflict in Terms. In the case of a conflict in terms between this Amendment and any Contract documents, this Amendment shall prevail. 
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Amendment in duplicate conformed originals as of the date first set forth above. 
CONTRACTOR: 	CITY: 
BFI Waste Services of Texas, LP. 	City of South Houston, Texas 
By: _______________ 	By: _______________ 
Name: _______________ 	
Name: _______________ 	
Title: _______________ 	Title: _______________ 
  
Section 4. - Severability Clause. 
The Council of the City of South Houston, Texas, does hereby declare that if any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence(s), clause, phrase, word or portion of this ordinance is declared invalid, or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction, that, in such event it would have passed and ordained any and all remaining portions of this ordinance without the inclusion of that portion or portions which may be so found to be unconstitutional or invalid, and declares that its intent is to make no portion(s) of this ordinance dependent upon the validity of any other portion thereof, and that all said remaining portions shall continue in full force and effect. 
PASSED AND APPROVED THIS 23 RD DAY OF AUGUST 2016. 
	      JOE SOTO, MAYOR 
      CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS

ARTICLE XIX. - ENTERPRISE TE PRODUCTS PIPELINE COMPANY, LLC 
ORDINANCE NO. 2016-17 
AN ORDINANCE GRANTING AUTHORITY UNDER ORDINANCE NO. 2012-08, CHAPTER 19, SECTION 19-5, OF THE CODE OF ORDINANCES OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, ENTITLED "INSTALLATION OF PIPELINES" (PIPELINE ORDINANCE) TO ENTERPRISE TE PRODUCTS PIPELINE COMPANY, LLC, THE RIGHT, PRIVILEGE AND FRANCHISE TO REUSE, REPLACE, MAINTAIN, OPERATE AND REMOVE AN EXISTING 12" PIPELINE (PIPELINE COMPANY LINE #P103/L2474; CITY DESIGNATED PIPELINE LINE #7) TO FACILITATE THE TRANSPORTATION OF DIESEL, FUEL OIL, AND OTHER LIQUID OR LIQUIFIED PETROLEUM PRODUCTS WITHIN THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS; PROVIDING FOR AN ANNUAL FEE; PRESCRIBING THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS UNDER WHICH SAID RIGHT, PRIVILEGE AND FRANCHISE IS GRANTED; AND PROVIDING FOR THE ACCEPTANCE THEREOF. 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, THAT: 
 
Section 1. - Franchise. 
The City Council (hereinafter called "CITY") hereby grants to ENTERPRISE TE PRODUCTS PIPELINE COMPANY, LLC, the right, privilege and franchise to reuse, replace, maintain, operate and remove an existing 12" pipeline (Pipeline company line #P103/L2474, City designated pipeline #7) in a location described as "in the Pipeline Corridor along the west side of 7th street, from the south City limit to the north City limit, the 7th pipeline east from the "west Pipeline Corridor easement line" within the City of South Houston, Texas, to facilitate the transportation of diesel, fuel oil, and other liquid or liquefied petroleum products. THIS IS ONLY A FRANCHISE FOR THE UNDERGROUND FACILITY AND NOT FOR ANY PIPELINE EQUIPMENT OR APPARATUS ABOVE-GROUND SAVE AND EXCEPT WARNING SIGNS WHICH SHALL BE ABOVE-GROUND.  
Section 2. - General Information. 
Franchisee: Enterprise TE Products Pipeline Company, LLC 
c/o Enterprise Products Company 
Attention: Land Department (L2474) 
P.O. Box 4324 
Houston, Texas 77210 
Franchisee's person in charge: 
Name: Michael D. Brown 
Title: Agent & Attorney-In-Fact 
E mail: leases@eprod.com 
Office Phone: 281-887-3305 
Franchisee shall keep current the above information and shall promptly notify the City Secretary in writing of any changes. Failure to comply with same shall carry a penalty of $500 per occurrence.  
Section 3. - Franchise Fees. 
The Franchisee shall pay to the City of South Houston an initial administrative fee in the amount of $1,500. Franchisee has also agreed to pay $2,000 for two previous years' annual fees plus the current year's annual fee of $1,000; and shall thereafter pay an annual fee of $1,000 on or before the anniversary date of the final passage of this Ordinance.  
Section 4. - Laws, Regulations, Rules and Permits. 
The franchisee's work done under the grant of authority contained herein shall be governed by all present and future laws, rules or regulations of this City, the State of Texas, or the United States of America. The franchisee shall obtain and keep current at its expense all permits and licenses required by law for so long as they are required.  
Section 5. - Indemnification and Insurance. 
The franchisee shall indemnify and hold the CITY harmless from any liability, cost, damage, attorney fees or costs of any kind resulting from the replacement, maintenance, operation and removal of the 12" pipeline by the franchisee, its LICENSED OPERATORS, agents, independent contractors or representatives. The Franchisee shall at all times during the life of the franchise maintain comprehensive general liability insurance for bodily injury and property damage, including explosion, collapse and underground hazard coverage, in the minimum combined single limit amount of $3,000,000, as it pertains to a public street, alley or other public way or easement. A certificate of insurance specifying the coverage shall be kept on file with the City Secretary.  
Section 6. - Term. 
This franchise is granted for a term of twenty-five (25) years from the date of adoption by City Council.  
Section 7. - Notice of transfer of ownership. 
Notice of transfer of ownership must be promptly given by the new owner to the City Secretary in each instance of the transfer of ownership of the pipeline. This franchise is not transferrable without the written consent of the City.  
Section 8. - Acceptance. 
Franchisee shall file its written acceptance of this Franchise with the City Secretary within thirty (30) days of final passage and shall thereupon be bound by the terms and conditions. 
PASSED and APPROVED this the 27 th day of SEPTEMBER 2016. 
	      JOE SOTO, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas

      LANCE AVANT, CITY SECRETARY

Franchisee's person in charge: 
Name: Daniel G. Gredvig 
Title: Attorney-in-fact 
E mail: dan_gredvig@kindermorgan.com 
Office Phone: 713-420-4061 
Fax: 713-667-7628 
Franchisee shall keep current the above information and shall promptly notify the City Secretary in writing of any changes. Failure to comply with same shall carry a penalty of $500 per occurrence.  
Section 3. - Franchise Fees. 
The Franchisee shall pay to the City of South Houston an initial administrative fee in the amount of $1,500. Franchisee has also agreed to pay $2,000 for two previous years' annual fees plus the current year's annual fee of $1,000, and shall thereafter pay an annual fee of $1,000 on or before the anniversary date of the final passage of this Ordinance.  
Section 4. - Laws, Regulations, Rules and Permits. 
The franchisee's work done under the grant of authority contained herein shall be governed by all present and future laws, rules or regulations of this City, the State of Texas, or the United States of America. The franchisee shall obtain and keep current at its expense all permits and licenses required by law for so long as they are required.  
Section 5. - Indemnification and Insurance. 
The franchisee shall indemnify and hold the CITY harmless from any liability, cost, damage, attorney fees or costs of any kind resulting from the replacement, maintenance, operation and removal of the 12" pipeline by the franchisee, its LICENSED OPERATORS, agents, independent contractors or representatives. The Franchisee shall at all times during the life of the franchise maintain comprehensive general liability insurance for bodily injury and property damage, including explosion, collapse and underground hazard coverage, in the minimum combined single limit amount of $3,000,000, as it pertains to a public street, alley or other public way or easement. A certificate of insurance specifying the coverage shall be kept on file with the City Secretary.  
Section 6. - Term. 
This franchise is granted for a term of twenty-five (25) years from the date of adoption by City Council.  
Section 7. - Notice of transfer of ownership. 
Notice of transfer of ownership must be promptly given by the new owner to the City Secretary in each instance of the transfer of ownership of the pipeline. This franchise is not transferrable without the written consent of the City.  
Section 8. - Acceptance. 
Franchisee shall file its written acceptance of this Franchise with the City Secretary within thirty (30) days of final passage and shall thereupon be bound by the terms and conditions. 
PASSED and APPROVED this the 27 th day of SEPTEMBER 2016. 
	      JOE SOTO, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas

      LANCE AVANT, CITY SECRETARY

Name: 	Shelly Heuser, Senior Vice President, TPC Group, LLC 
E mail: 	dmangum@buckeye.com 
Office Phone: 	832-325-1626 
Fax: 	832-214-6949 
 
Franchisee shall keep current the above information and shall promptly notify the City Secretary in writing of any changes. Failure to comply with same shall carry a penalty of $500 per occurrence.  
Section 3. - Franchise Fees. 
Ordinance 378, dated March 19, 1956, granted the original pipeline owner, Petro Tex Chemical, the right to install and operate this pipeline. This ordinance will bring the current owner, TPC Group, LLC, into compliance with Ordinance No. 2012-08 (new pipeline ordinance). The Franchisee has paid $1,000 for 2016 annual fees due under Ordinance No. 2012-08 and shall pay to the City of South Houston an annual fee of $1,000 on or before the anniversary date of the final passage of this Ordinance.  
Section 4. - Laws, Regulations, Rules and Permits. 
The Franchisee's work done under the grant of authority contained herein shall be governed by all present and future laws, rules or regulations of this City, the State of Texas, or the United States of America. The Franchisee shall obtain and keep current at its expense all permits and licenses required by law for so long as they are required.  
Section 5. - Indemnification and Insurance. 
The Franchisee shall indemnify and hold the CITY harmless from any liability, cost, damage, attorney fees or costs of any kind resulting from the replacement, maintenance, operation and removal of the 4" pipeline by the Franchisee, its LICENSED OPERATORS, agents, independent contractors or representatives. The Franchisee shall at all times during the life of the Franchise maintain comprehensive general liability insurance for bodily injury and property damage, including explosion, collapse and underground hazard coverage, in the minimum combined single limit amount of $3,000,000, as it pertains to a public street, alley or other public way or easement. A certificate of insurance specifying the coverage shall be kept on file with the City Secretary.  
Section 6. - Term. 
This Franchise is granted for a term of twenty-five (25) years from the date of adoption by City Council.  
Section 7. - Notice of transfer of ownership. 
Notice of transfer of ownership must be promptly given by the new owner to the City Secretary in each instance of the transfer of ownership of the pipeline. This Franchise is not transferrable without the written consent of the City.  
Section 8. - Acceptance. 
Franchisee shall file its written acceptance of this Franchise with the City Secretary within thirty (30) days of final passage and shall thereupon be bound by the terms and conditions. 
PASSED and APPROVED this the  10th  day of JANUARY 2017. 
	      JOE SOTO, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas

BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF SOUTH HOUSTON, TEXAS, THAT: 
 
Section 1. - Franchise. 
The City Council (hereinafter called "CITY") hereby grants to ENTERPRISE HOUSTON SHIP CHANNEL, L.P., ECHO TO EHT SYSTEM, the right, privilege and franchise to construct, install, erect, reuse, replace, maintain, operate and remove a 30" pipeline (company pipeline #C130, City pipeline #21) in a location described as "along the pipeline corridor on the west side of 7 th street, more specifically described as the 2 nd pipeline west of the east easement line of the pipeline corridor from the south city limits to the north city limits within the City of South Houston, Texas"; to facilitate the transportation of crude oil and condensate in accordance with the plans and specifications to be filed with the City Secretary. The 30" pipeline shall be designed by the applicant's engineer and then finally submitted to the City's consulting engineer for his review and approval. Without the approval of the City 's consulting engineer, the applicant may do no work on the 30" pipeline or the project. The applicant's final engineering/surveying plans and specifications (containing the City's consulting engineer's written approval) shall be filed with the City Secretary. The applicant shall furnish reproducible copies of the final approved drawings. THIS IS ONLY A FRANCHISE FOR THE UNDERGROUND FACILITY AND NOT FOR ANY PIPELINE EQUIPMENT OR APPARATUS ABOVE-GROUND SAVE AND EXCEPT WARNING SIGNS WHICH SHALL BE ABOVE-GROUND.

Applicant shall keep current the above information and shall promptly notify the City Secretary in writing of any changes. failure to comply with same shall carry a penalty of $500.00 per occurrence.  
Section 3. - Franchise Fees. 
The Franchisee applicant shall pay to the City of South Houston pursuant to Ordinance 2012-08 a construction fee in the amount of $6,268 which represents the fee per linear foot for new construction, an administrative fee in the amount of $1,500 and $1,000 for the first year's franchise fee. The total fees are $8,768. The Franchisee shall thereafter pay an annual fee of $1,000.00 on or before the anniversary date of the final passage of this Ordinance.  
Section 4. - Laws, Regulations, Rules and Permits. 
The Franchisee applicant and all work done under the grant of authority contained herein shall be governed by all present and future laws, rules or regulations of this City, the State of Texas, or the United States of America. The Franchisee applicant shall obtain and keep current at its expense all permits and licenses required by law for so long as they are required. This franchise is not transferrable without the written consent of the City.  
Section 5. - Indemnification and Insurance. 
In each application for a permit, each person, firm or corporation to whom a permit is issued shall indemnify and hold the CITY harmless from any liability, cost, damage, attorney's fees or costs of any kind resulting from the construction, installation, replacement, maintenance, operation and removal of the 30" pipeline by the Franchisee applicant, its LICENSED OPERATORS, agents, independent contractors or representatives. The Franchisee shall at all times during the life of the Franchise maintain comprehensive general liability insurance for bodily injury and property damage, including explosion, collapse and underground hazard coverage, in the minimum combined single limit amount of $3,000,000, as it pertains to a public street, alley or other public way or easement. A certificate of insurance specifying the coverage shall be kept on file with the City Secretary.  
Section 6. - Term. 
This Franchise is granted for a term of twenty-five (25) years from the date of adoption by City Council.  
Section 7. - Notice of Transfer of Ownership. 
Notice of transfer of ownership must be promptly given by the new owner to the City Secretary in each instance of the transfer of ownership of the pipeline. This Franchise is not transferrable without the written consent of the City.  
Section 8. - Plans and Inspections. 
All work and design shall be done in a good and workmanlike manner in accordance with the Plans and Specs on file with the City. City's consulting engineer or his designated inspector or the City building official shall personally inspect the work. Prior notice of the construction activity shall be given to the City before any construction efforts are closed-in or filled. No excavated areas shall be un-barricaded overnight. any construction changes shall require the approval of the City consulting engineer. City inspection expenses shall be reimbursed by applicant Franchisee. The precise location of the 30" pipeline shall be suggested by the applicant Franchisee and approved by a City inspector prior to commencement of excavation or digging. The area shall be left and kept at all times clean, neat, and presentable and free of rubbish and hazards such as holes or sharp objects.  
Section 9. - Acceptance. 
Applicant Franchisee shall file its written acceptance of this Franchise with the City Secretary within thirty (30) days of final passage and shall thereupon be bound by the terms and conditions. 
PASSED and APPROVED this the  28th  day of FEBRUARY 2017. 
	      JOE SOTO, MAYOR 
      City of South Houston, Texas

      LANCE AVANT, CITY SECRETARY
